eV5V6kbJsbAjM8MF1u4oYQ.text: With a little trepidation... I will leak my new favorite breakfast spot.  Mac's is a nice little neighborhood bar, nice selection of brews on tap, good food of a great variety and excellent staff.  Its location is what helps make it a standout, it is in one of the best strips in all of Phoenix.  Book-ended by Tempe's best bookstore and Tempe's most in-touch record store, this is the perfect place to start or finish a weekend morning.  The thing about the breakfast here is that it has two of my favorite qualities:  good and cheap.  Not cheap ingredients, nope.  Apple cider bacon, pecan pancakes, heavy and delicious huevos.  All of their offerings center around 6 bucks.  In Tempe, which is notoriously over priced in the early morning offerings, that is very cheap breakfast.  The light enters the room just right in the morning, casting amber hues around the room as you sip coffee, listen to pretty bad music and enjoy your hearty breakfast.  Take a stroll to Trader Joes, buy a few albums at Hoodlums and work up an appetite for Tott's (which is right across the street).

yHz3fci5qRjuDWbJvbImJg.text: 2nd time was a charm. 1st time was not too great but we give every place a second chance!  Glad we did. Food was great and service was great. Adrienne was our server and she was awesome!  We will be back!!

DWcAjGlcyc4W2purGxBN0w.text: I go this this place all the time.  I always have great service and consistently good food and cold beer.

I5rPUOtDWI5YMJ4ipJRPFw.text: My wish is that everyone could have a place like Mac's that's a short walk or bike ride from home. I've been known on occasion to drag my tired self in there on a Sunday for breakfast and mimosas.   The food is good pub/American fare and the wait staff is pretty friendly. (I snarked at one poor server for calling me "ma'am" but he rallied and we're now on a first-name basis.) I'm a fan of the breakfast burrito. The huevos rancheros are okay but not very spicy. The queso is tasty and they have a sinful grilled cheese sandwich. Plus, I like that they have Sunbru and Smithwick's on tap.  Mac's is sandwiched between two fantastic Tempe gems - Changing Hands Bookstore and Hoodlums Music and Movies. I definitely recommend you shop BEFORE you eat/drink, though. Trust me! I've learned from experience...

UUdIrVOpEip-cUZ5HqeDDw.text: Consistently good food, large variety on the menu. Good pours on drinks and cold beer on tap. Try the Four Peaks Peach Ale. Yum!

wlNXlY4P2FPqgg2ZeFz_QQ.text: Great beer prices at happy Hour. The wraps are pretty darn good too.

wgAbFRn3dkRtlxuq5ibRyw.text: Ok so been here twice now service slow but friendly both times. Food is OK not awesome not bad. The burger seems to be the best thing we have has here. I want to love this place but they should get the basics down before trying to get all fancy. So I won't be rushing back however I won't avoid the place either.

TNJS2axnQVJJVX-kWn8Y_Q.text: Nice little neighborhood strip bar bar and grill.  Decent selection of beers including a few locals.  Food is the main reason people come here.  Burgers are big 1/2 pound burgers.  Plenty of other options including salads and steaks.  Service was good and friendly.  Our waiter said he has worked there 10 years so that says something about the place.  Looking forward to trying their weekend brunch during football season.

lt3ZRlk9nYo82WKAHjl_oA.text: Love Mac's   Great food and good service.  They could use additional beers on tap though but they do have featured beets which is great.   They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner.

oeB56_TMB2kLb9dY9PIVPg.text: For a neighborhood restaurant / bar, it is hard to beat Mac's. They serve really good food at a fair price. The people are nice and the atmosphere is comfortable.  I often visit for lunch, the burgers are hard to resist.  Some of their happy hour specials are hard to beat. Try the chicken quesadilla, I think it's a few bucks during HH and it is really good.   Weekend breakfasts, tasty dinners, fun beer tastings and a good place to watch a game are a few more reasons to visit Mac's.  A True gem in Tempe...

SzH9v-DOo6SRgG6dvKdguw.text: Another establishment where you kinda have to question the sanity of a negative reviewer.  What is not to like about Mac's?  Sometimes they are understaffed, which can be a bummer if you're hungry.  Aside from that, their food is top notch (for a bar/grill), the environment is warm and friendly, and the drinks are always good and cold. Try the cajun shrimp appetizer or the spicy roast beef sandwich.  Hell, even the chili is great, especially paired with a frosty Odell IPA.  I could probably eat here three to five times a week if Providence allowed.  Support your local family eateries!

b9PU3uHDuYUmE_ZOWnOd1g.text: We chose this place as it serves breakfast and lunch so the boy and I could both have what we desired.  I'm not sure why since we both wanted breakfast, but I'm all about checking out new places in his hood since it is super unfamiliar at this point.  The breakfast menu is meat tastic.  No spicy veggie omelet for me.  I decided on the grilled cheese and Cajun fries.  It all went down just fine but it came up a couple hours later.  I have a stomach of steel so I'm not sure what went wrong.  I ended up spending my Saturday afternoon laid up and pukey.  Not cool.  I don't think we'll be returning.  P.S.- The boy ordered steak and eggs.  They don't have A1 which I know is pretty much against a meat eater's rules and standards.

c0ZdeytkgZLZk5qYxhwjyg.text: If you live in Tempe you know there is no shortage of bars in our blazing college town. What happens when you graduate from college and walking across that stage to get your diploma also means you grow into a need for local hangouts where everybody still knows your name...just without the fight song sing-alongs and the floor so sticky you can't make it to the bathroom without losing a shoe?   Mac's Broiler & Tap is a quiet neighborhood hangout that still has that ever-present Tempe college spirit...for grown ups. Delicious bar food is abundant, beer is flowing from the tap, great daily specials and the service makes you feel right at home.   I stopped by on a Saturday night and found it crowded with enough room to move around and enjoy the place. We easily found two seats at the bar at cozied up for a few drinks and some good conversation. Drinks are reasonably priced and you will nearly always be greeted by a stranger with a friendly hello.   What may be it's strongest selling point is Mac's phenomenal location. In what may very well be one of the best corners in Tempe, Mac's is nestled in between one of the state's most amazing independent book sellers, Changing Hands and Trader Joe's grocery store. With so much going for it, make a day out of it!

VZypmJKQbmBLU3-QvxgpMQ.text: I really, really wanted to just get my Sunday NYT and go to Wildflower Bread Company (next to Changing Hands bookstore) for breakfast/brunch. They have the best menu and it is open till 2pm for us later birds. Problem is on Sunday, everyone else has the same exact idea. Peeked in, no tables. Sure, it can open up fast, but seeing the endless coloured flags on people's tables meant no food, no turnover for a while.  So, my brother in his Jet's jersey, sad we were already 45 minutes into the game against the Patriots saw the Mac's Grill & Tap serves brunch and snagged a booth while I surveyed the sad, busy, non-turnover rate at Wilflower.  Sometimes getting a seat fast at breakfast is the only thing to be happy about. Oh, and they had like eight tvs set up so he could watch the game. Both of these traits earned the star.  The waitress gave us coffee (and a beer) quickly. Water took a while. Out of grapefruit juice. Let me get you oj. This goes on for like 15 minutes. And she hasn't taken our order yet b/c everytime she notices something, she runs away in panic and comes back an average of 5 to 10 minutes later. So she is trying. But there are two other servers, four other benches, a bar, two high tables and tables in the front that serve maybe 15 people, not including outside. Okay, there was another server besides then. Breakfast was meat heavy, but cheap. Don't have homefries (panic button!), only hash. Bad sign, b-fest people.  It ended up being at least a 25 minute wait. My pancakes were huge, rubbery (obviously microwaved), the eggs were runny, the hashbrowns greasey-and no freakin toast-apparently have to ask seperately for that (?!?). The bananas and pecans to be folded in-there was a generous topping of 4 banana slices and 5 pecans on top! Score! Unappealing.  I have passed by this place a lot since I frequent Changing Hands, Trader Joes and Wildflower in the same complex-and I will continue to do so. Catch a beer and some greasey food to watch the game if you are into that and happen to be at Guadalupe and McClintock. But for christs sake, next time, I will gladly wait the 10 minutes for a table at Wildflower!!!

9gJuBcIddb0tLGnZR7fglg.text: Went here on Sunday with a large group of 8 people for breakfast.  They had traditional choices and the people in our group ordered the Classic Breakfast (2 eggs, hash browns, toast for $4.95), the breakfast burrito, eggs benedict and veggie omelette.  My eggs over medium were perfect and everyone liked their meal.    The staff was very accommodating of our large group and had no problem with us adding on a person well after the rest of us had been seated.  I would definitely go again.

rWozTrbiYuoCtPDKJhgbPA.text: One of my favorite breakfast/Blood Mary spots in town. Cool atmosphere of classic rock records on the fall, with a great staff of people. Family-owned business.

6pNGKmOQK5D_PfZekM2Hew.text: We have been to Mac's twice in the past week as we happened to be next door at Changing Hands, once for a book signing and then again to pick up our signed books (that we had to leave because the signing ran late).  On the first visit it was fairly busy due to the book signing but we were seated in about 20 mins.  I ordered the California Chicken Sandwich with a side of red potato salad.  Both were excellent.  My chicken had no fat, and was cooked well but still very juicy.  The potato salad was very flavorful.  My only small complaint would be that a few pieces of potato seemed a bit underdone.  No biggie.  My wife had the BLTTA with the French fries.  She really enjoyed the sandwich but found the toast to be a bit hard and had to ask for soft bread to transfer it to, even so, she enjoyed it quite a bit.  The bacon was very tasty.  The fries were skinny and crispy, but nothing special.  We thought about dessert, but the menu is a bit limited there, so we decided on the ZoYo place across the street.  On our second visit it seemed even busier (Friday night) although we were seated more quickly.  We ordered off the menu for the appetizer and asked for a fruit bowl, which they were happy to provide for only $4. It was a nice way to start our meal.  For dinner I ordered the 7 oz. sirloin with a baked potato.  It also comes with a roll (yummy) and some grilled (I think) veggies, which were cooked perfectly.  The steak was ordered medium and was perfectly done and delicious.  The only complaint here was for the baked potato.  I was asked if i wanted butter or sour cream and after saying sour cream I ended up with both but no other toppings (chives, bacon bits, etc.).  I guess the menu didn't say it was loaded, but I expected more.  My wife ordered the pasta primavera and substituted the penne with linguini noodles.  She was initially hesitant about trying it because she thought it smelled weird.  I tried it first and it was fantastic. The pasta was done perfectly and the veggies were still a little crunchy and the white wine sauce was awesome.  Great dish.  Both visits we had more than adequate service.  The wait staff was attentive and we never had a need to track them down.  These two visits were our only times visiting the place, but we will definitely be back!  It is a great place to eat while out record (Hoodlums) and book (Changing Hands) browsing.  The yogurt place across the street was great as well.  We had a great evening both nights.

wV5OwXo6yoOC-JBDTjtAsA.text: I stopped in for dinner with friends and thought it was a great little place. It was only $5.50 for a huge spinach/queso dip with salsa and was enough for the two of us to split as a main course.  The menu is very affordable...$6.50 - $7.50 for a burger with your choice of a side and they had some great looking salads for $7.50. I think the most expensive thing on the menu was a $12 steak.  They isn't a lot of seating, but we got in fast, even during the Satuday night rush, and the service was great. I'll be back!

PFafQHjlKKpa7vtyHx3EOg.text: I am a vegetarian and this is my favorite steakhouse.  I am not even kidding, I really like this place.  This place actually has several really good vegetarian options.  I love the grilled cheese sandwich, they make it with excellent bread, different types of cheeses and tomatoes.  It's amazing.  I also had a pasta dish that was really, really good if a little gigantic.  I am always tempted to see if I can just order all the stuff that comes with a steak without the steak.  My boyfriend orders steaks, and the sides are really amazing.  They do vegetables, rolls and everything really well.  I love the onion side thing.

31sjnV7shFMHvgDtyqJxJQ.text: I got sick and had stomach cramps for two days after eating a buffalo chicken sandwich here.  Stay away from the food!  Standard nice small place to get a beer after shopping in the bookstore next door, with nice friendly staff otherwise.

-5DHp1aMxccn8GVcfdAskQ.text: Amazing burgers! The Burger of the Month never disappoints! Great beer selection! And every plate that walks by looks awesome too! Love Mac's!

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States

mhrc-85WS6g4nKXusTZ09w.text: Good French Onion soup.  Entrees were very good. Steak was perfectly cooked and tender.  Pasta had great flavor and shrimp were superb.

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States

gPpAUahVb5i02vSVZWvGyw.text: I eat here a few times a week for lunch. The service is great and the food is tasty. I like the frequent lunch punch card program.   The beers on tap are rotated with gems. I highly recommend Mac's.

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lots of beer on tap

nQ9V6Pt97RYYC6l5KEvoPA.text: Horrible experience tonight.  While we were seated quickly and a drink order taken, it took 5 minutes to get them from our waitress and when we ordered another , it was another 10 minutes.  Order was placed after we were there for 15 minutes and then it took 20 minutes to get a salad and 2 soups. Had to ask about our actual dinner after 45 minutes for it to come out cold.  We asked to have it warmed up and the manager came over, apologized and said they had some new people.  She offered to but a round of drinks but we were done at that point.  We had to hunt down our check, and when it arrived, she did remove a beer and an ice tea.  Bill was over $65, she should have taken off one of the dinners.  We've had an issue before but like to support local however, we won't be back and I highly doubt they care.  The table next to us got so frustrated they left after waiting so long for just drinks.

SNaY69-xjTJsFyl3iXqM5w.text: This is a hidden gem. I'm in this complex all the time and never remember that it's here. That said, it's great because they aren't slammed busy and you get seated right away and the service is fast. I ordered the lunch special which was a roast beef sandwich with green chiles and pepper jack cheese. It came with a side of sweet potato fries. The lunch was good, but not great. My friends ordered sandwiches and salads. The sandwiches are huge and we all had to take home one half of our sandwich. The salads looked delicious and I wish I would've got one of those also. I loved the sports themed atmosphere and the relaxed ambience. The price was right between 10 and $20. I have been here for breakfast before and must say that I enjoyed my breakfast more than my lunch today. Overall I really really like this place and will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States. It&#39;s a sports bar too!
Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States. Roast beef with green chile and sweet potato fries. Yum!

cvvZtbN7TS5c_gUUrGauOQ.text: Ate here just because I was going to a book signing at Changing Hands and needed to stay near by.  The food is a bit overpriced for what you get and the vegetarian choices are almost none.  I got a 4 cheese grilled cheese.  It was good but not what I would usually order for dinner.  It came with a choice of sides and I got fruit.  It was a little over ripe.   The mojito I had was yummy though.

DEXB5u0CMN_YKm8ugEJIrw.text: I came here with a regular over the weekend and really enjoyed it.  Granted, I wasn't sober when I arrived and surely didn't remain sober while there.  But, on a Saturday, when the work is done - there's nothing wrong with that.  The bartender, who was fantastic, recommended the Cuban sandwich - which was on special.  My buddy swore up and down that the bacon bleu cheese burger was spot on.  So, like any respectable men would do, we shared half and half.  The only negative on the burger was that the bun wasn't worthy of every other ingredient.  Some times the meat and cheese are so perfect, that an ordinary bun takes away from the delish factor.  The Cuban, while good, was very messy.  When sandwiches are finished in a press, I expect there to be minimal mess.  That said, the pork inside was roasted to perfection and the pickles were tasty.  Add to this a couple of delicious micro-brews and it was a very nice surprise.  I will be back, and would recommend trying this joint to anyone in the area!

CCzUoo1xgCRxWqaZC0KTEg.text: Stopped in for a cold brew after a out if town trip. HAPPY HOUR success!  Good, attentive service and fresh food. My salad was perfect.  A nice place to hang out and visit with friends.  Could have stayed a few more hours!  There are TV'S on the wall for game watching. I have to keep that in mind once football season is in full swing.   MACs has a different vibe than loud sports bars and I get the feeling most of  patrons live in the neighborhood. I will be going back.

8DvfkeVvfUqYEmHmc6xSHA.text: This place is awesome. Bartender was great. Very helpful. I had the best burger I have had in months. The patties are made fresh, never frozen, by the owner. Service was great. The beer was cold. And the company pleasant.

QohU3xArNOKzt4tydDp4Eg.text: I had a bunless mushroom and cheese burger. It was very good. It was medium well and it really was cooked nicely. Alysia was our attender and she did a very good job explaining the menu as well as meet and greet us. All in all a good experience. I will go back to check out third weekend breakfast menu for sure

SNYXEZ_Olg-OT9Q4Rr0rrA.text: We've been going to Mac's for many years.  They make my favorite sandwich, the BLTTA (bacon lettuce turkey tomato and avocado) and the staff is always pleasant.  This is a good place to meet a friend for a weekday lunch, the in-laws on Sunday after church, or come on Friday night and have beers with your friends.  However, about a year ago, the service was TERRIBLE for five visits solid.  We stopped going to Mac's.  Today we met my in-laws for lunch and HOORAY, the old Mac's is back!!!  Our server, Ben, did a great job taking care of us, and the food was delicious.  So glad we gave Mac's another chance.  Try their burger of the month--always a treat!!!

3p-moMDvjEhkecDRUNedSA.text: Went to Mac's for lunch. I had been a few times and wanted to take a work friend.  Service was poor, food took forever and we were blown away when we received the check and realized the hamburgers were $16.50.  I guess we should have noticed the price when we ordered, but I have never heard of a $16.50 hamburger, especially from a family restaurant like Mac's.  In all fairness, the food was good.  Not sure if the food was good enough to offset the overpriced burger and slow service.

UiUPGDtVRgZjpPb3w0aL3w.text: 3 ladies on a Thursday at 5P.  Nice atmosphere, small, pleasant outdoor patio.  Our server seemed...frustrated.  We were never clear on the HH food offerings.  No HH menu.  Beer in a bottle?  We were provided with a handwritten note pulled from the servers little black order book.  On tap?  Server pointed to a wall menu across the restaurant which we could not read from our table.  So far, not particularly impressed.  Ordered Mac's Queso Dip to start.  Delicious!  A good sign?  Fish and chips, average.  Tarter sauce is too much mayo and not much else. Spicy Jalapeno Burger?  Also average, at best.  Could taste the jalapenos otherwise not much flavor and it was served on two bottom buns.  Positive note, we both requested extra crispy fries and they were perfect.  French onion soup is good but not the best I've ever had.   Chicken and Candied Pecan salad was huge, had beautiful presentation and was good.  Overall, nothing to bring me back.

vEJsxxXFmlIJrgHCnCwjPA.text: I should have done this review earlier! This place is great with local brews, foods, and awesome service. My family and I have gotten the burgers, chicken, even the pasta! All have been great outcomes. I need to come here to watch football, their starters, like the queso sauce, is so good!

oR-QG6J5vWOdr5hjlCAQuQ.text: I have been going to Macs once or twice a month for a couple years now.  I have to say that I LOVE the food, and it doesn't hurt that they have Odell beer on tap!  Why only 3 stars you ask?    The first star is lost because the service is consistently bad.  Really bad, like you were forgotten about bad.  Bad enough that a number of my friends will not meet  me there for lunch based on past visits.  The other star gone because the owners are pinching pennies in all the wrong ways, like serving Tempe tap water that is clearly not filtered and tastes nasty.  The water is bad enough that the employees don't drink it.   I have complained about it a number of times, and they make it clear that it is a common complaint but haven't fixed it yet.     Also kind of a minor thing that other reviewers have noted, unless a customer specifically says no lettuce, tomato or onion, include all of them without having the server ask. I understand that the business owner might save a few pennies by not wasting food, but could probably make up for it by retaining more customers.  All in all I will still go to Macs from time to time.  I have a hard time recommending it to friends but will swing in for lunch and a beer if I am in the neighborhood.

DWmIdFQG7gHw-L_MVKYUDQ.text: 3.5 stars.    Mac's is a cute little neighborhood grill that offers up some big screens to watch the game, good food and a decent selection of beer.  It did take a while to get our food but if you're absorbed by the game, it's really no big deal.  Maybe the cooks are into the game too. haha  I'd recommend the mushroom burger.  It was pretty tasty!  Might see ya there.

pUzqjjRGkohs-UCYp4dHBg.text: Been going to Macs for years and we our favorites. Their burgers are great, fresh quality hand ground beef grilled to perfection with thick cheese and bacon on top. The only thing missing is sliced pickles! Reviews are a tricky thing because you don't know what the writer's frame of reference is, so I will tell you I like the burgers at Zin burger, the Grind and Deluxe.  The steak fries are nice too.   Their broccoli Alfredo, add chicken, is amazing. The chicken is amazingly tender and the sauce is flavorful, albeit thick, and rich so I suggest sharing it with a friend. Love this dish.   The sauce they make for their chimi appetizer is fantastic too - rich and flavorful. This is a great little spot, yes the service can be slow at times when they get busy,  but its good food in a sea of mediocre and national chains.

5jnSHuDtYp3N-ajAzRWV1w.text: Burgers are bomb! I love the burgers, they have really good fries also, I always order the Cajun steak fries. The one thing that is almost always disappointing is the service. I would say 90 percent of the time the service is Horrible. I guess you'd have to go and try it out yourself, you might get lucky and have a great waitress or waiter.

CSa8xCkauVmc06uPMUzEjQ.text: This place is great.  The owner must be my age, because I would swear that my exact record collection from high school is on the walls as decoration.  I love that you can bring your kids here and watch the game out of the corner of your eye, in an environment that is totally kid friendly. The food is really good. I like the hand ground burgers and the cheese steak and my kids think the chicken tenders rock.  They have a couple good Odell beers on tap, which doesn't hurt. It used to be nestled between a great book store (Changing Hands) and a great record store, but alas the record store went out of business.  Glad Changing Hands is prospering here since moving off Mill Ave way back when.  Nice work Mac, wherever you are.

lzD9fKVMOL4EYVm51s_9cg.text: Mac's has become a 'go-to' local restaurant for us when we can't decide what we're hungry for. In our 15-or-so meals there we've been pleasantly surprised by the specials, from homey comfort foods like pot roast or meatloaf to seafood and pasta dishes that exceeded my expectations. No matter what you get, sandwiches, burgers or a dinner, they do a good job. Their breakfast menu is limited but everything we've had is very good.  If you arrive after 6pm be prepared to wait. Mac's is no longer a secret. They're usually packed during the dinner hours. You can get in and out fast for Sunday morning breakfast if you arrive before 10am.

CIyOLT1eImgXBpxM-RalBA.text: I have to give this place 5 stars. I was expecting bad service and bad water (according to one yelp review).   However, I'm drinking water as we speak (and it's just fine) along with a fantastic mimosa (which may be why the water tastes fine). Mimosa is $5 and it's large and in charge, unlike zipps up the road, for example. I can't stand mimosas in tiny flutes.   Garlic wings were badass.   Servers (two) are outstanding and very mindful of making sure we are taken care of. She even asked for permission to serve my son another sprite. I thought that was very polite.   5 stars and nothing less.  Btw if u order a burger u get your first beer draft for under $2. Just sayin.

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States. Good mimosas

rUuucDLzqIsA2zK89xEq6g.text: Easily one of the best locally owned restaurants in Tempe. I've been going here for a while now and I everything on their menu is good. You can't go wrong with their French dip or their Cuban sandwich. Goes great with Tabasco sauce haha. You also have to try their Cajun fries. The servers are very personable and you aren't low balled on the food portions. 5 stars for sure

xcTRcZ8eRMITpRVtjjYT4A.text: 4 stars for the food and a generous 2 stars for the service...which isn't so much the wait staff but the kitchen.  We've been there twice in the past few weeks and each time we've been one of only a handful of tables occupied.  The first time the food was served 45 minutes after we ordered and this morning it took 35 minutes.  The excuse this morning was that our order took so much longer than usual because I ordered my burger medium well...so it was my fault.  So a word to the wise...the food is good but the service is very slow and they (the staff) really don't seem to care.  Their attitude seems to be "stay or leave" we could care less.    Read Emiley B's review of last week (3/20/17) and Brian J's review of last year (7/2/16) and be forewarned this place is not particularly well managed...or they would have fixed these issues by now!

qwzv2wPaVxkVNeNHx2GQ0g.text: I've heard a lot about Mac's, but we'd never gone for some strange reason.  Whenever I shop at Trader Joe's I remind myself that we need to try it.  We finally did, and we were pleasantly surprised.  Mac's is a delightful neighborhood bar and restaurant.  We were pleased with the craft beer selections and the happy hour drink prices.  We sat at the bar and got great quick service.  My hubby and I ordered the BBQ sandwich and the steak sandwich and shared.  The BBQ sandwich was full of different textures.  It had huge pickeles and cole slaw on it, which I love in a pulled pork sandwich.  We both thought the steak sandwich would have thin strips, but it came with hearty, soft like butter chunks of steak.  It was so tender and juicy.  My hubby loved the thick cut fries.  We will be back.  It might even be our new neighborhood hangout.

WbS2eqbF5HDtSjIbeQoRsQ.text: The food was made to order and fresh out of the kitchen.  The service was really, really, really slow.

hhCpShV1R5FzyHgQNZKKWA.text: Excellent neighborhood restaurant and bar. Appropriate for single folks and families. Stopped on last night after baseball game for a burger and drink. Everything was fantastic - grilled to perfection, generous portions, fresh and enjoyable. Lots of big screens playing a variety of sports - not too loud, combined with LP album displays throughout. When you try it out, it's a sure thing that you'll go back.

8JCjLcuLSeauewalBIaAGA.text: Yummy!! The service and food were fantastic. There Happy hour is until 7 which works great for those of us who work til 6. We had a couple of items off the HH Menu. The steak quesadilla is delicious.

qkN-IYKPbQ3ZroxdS9vuZw.text: I've been here five times, and every time I've had a different waitress but the same situation- Sit for twenty minutes waiting for a drink order. Sit for another ten waiting for the drink. Sit for another thirty waiting for our food. I have one hour for lunch, and every time I've been here, I leave without eating.   There are more than a dozen empty tables. There are at least six waiters. Why is my water glass empty? Why have been waiting for an hour for a burger? Why do I bother to keep trying? The food isn't worth the wait. You're better off across the street at The Habit.  EDIT: I tried this place again last week. It's just so close to my boyfriend's work. We were told to seat ourselves, then waited for seven minutes before just walking out and going across the street to The Habit for our burger. Seven minutes and not even a glass of water? The server passed us three times, too, with no eye contact. I have no idea if anyone even knew we were there.

E5uGR18gbw7_lMmmdWH3Kg.text: Macs has the best house ground hamburgers.  I like mine with lettuce and tomato, Heinz 57 and French fried potato.  There is also a varied selection of both local and nationwide craft beer.  I personally like the Huevos Rancheros, a Bloody Mary and NFL or College football on the weekends.  FYI.... The are open for breakfast for the early games.  All in all a good ole regular neighborhood eatery!

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States. The Bar

YilL_-UA0KOWDOB_nHF4cg.text: We use to come here almost once a week for years because we loved their food and prices were decent. But the last 3 years the service and quality has gone down. Had issues from long wait for food, to meat being tough or paying for an 8 oz primerib consisting of 5 ozs of fat and the server having an attitude that it was my problem and not theirs. Unapologetic and not willing to make it right has been the ongoing experiences we had there.  After much hesitation we gave them one more chance, and   now finally decided its our last. There was the three if us. Placed our orders and when food came, one ordered hamburger with no pickles or onions and asked for skinny fries, not the thick steak fries. None of the order came out as requested. My dinner I asked for baked instead of mashed potatoes. That didnt happen. The third person ordered medium cooked tri tip dinner special. And after attempting to eat a tough, hard to cut and chew tri tip meat they finally gave up and left half of it when server cleared the plate. Was asked how it was and said meat was too tough. The server said they would talk to manager but never came back to tell us what happened.  So I had asked the server, what was the managers answer and she said maybe they needed to have cooked the meat longer. And that was it. No manager explaining directly to us and neither an apology. Nothing, period.  What.?? Do you want satisfied customers?  I think not and definitely not returning ones. Period.

HRtnhv4Pept-9iLDKIIMTA.text: Service HORRIBLE tables seated after us and got their orders taken before us. Took almost 45 min for wings that was supposed to be an appetizer. Food awful.

tsOPlXde0QpTtr4p34MZsA.text: First time we went to Mac's it was a Friday at 1:00.  We thought it might be a good time to avoid some of the lunchtime crowd .  Half the tables were empty but took waiter 20 minutes to take our order and another 30 minutes before the food arrived.  My husband chose the classic cheese burger which was big and done just right, medium but his frys were cold.  I ordered Mac's fish sandwich which was not what I expected.  The white fish was undercooked, translucent and slimmy.  I ate the lettuce and tomato and the bun along with the coldslaw.  Not a good 1st visit.

h-gFUPRHRMJK9x9lG_SrWw.text: I have been a regular customer here for just under twelve years. Tonight was the worst experience ever. The server was sarcastic and rude. The food was not up to their normal standards. I was afraid to tell the server because she probably would have thrown it at me.

7f0eQ0h981jjuXv5wJHQjQ.text: Went there for a late night dinner and beer. I was greeted instantly when I walk through the door. I sat at the bar and waited for my girlfriend to join. Bar service was on point. I would say the food was average for a tap room. The service is what made me give them 5 stars.

nLRVsPC597A2_c4Unooj_w.text: Great place, food, and staff. Nicolle will make you feel like one of the family. And I heard they are bring back Kelly with the good hair. Lenee  runs a tight ship.

X6eBunK6gwLCZz7-d4TF5A.text: Hello,  I recently attempted to have dinner at your restaurant on Friday night, March 17th.  I wanted to explain why I say "attempt" because, even though we say there for 40 minutes, we didn't ever get to eat.  We came in around 7:30-7:45 on Friday.  The hostess sat us at a little table, right by the door to the patio.  The reason I am giving you a description is because I did not catch the servers name, but assume you would be able to know who was in which section that night.  We were greeted pretty quickly, ordered waters, and immediately ordered potato skins as an appetizer.  The server stated she was going to put in our appetizer and be back to take our order.  She returned a few minutes later and took the food order.  We then waited 35-40 minutes for our app.  It never came.  Our food never came.  I then went up to the bar and asked a different server to check on our food.  Our server was told we were missing potato skins, looked back at us confused, came over and said we never ordered an app.  I said yes we did, potato skins.  And she said, no she doesn't have one coming.  I then mentioned I was 2 months pregnant and NEEDED to eat.  She told me the food would be 5-10 more minutes.  I was so completely sick and starving, that my fiance and I could not wait, we were forced to leave and get a cheeseburger across the street at the Habit.    Here are my areas of opportunity, as someone who trains customer service for a living, and worked in restaurants for 10 years. 1.  Write orders down, especially if you are busy.  Customers don't find it impressive to use your memory, especially when you forget things 2. Fix the problem, don't push blame! 3. Go get my food asap.  I know you can call things "on the fly" when pocket tickets are completed. 4. Don't look at the customer from across the restaurant with a confused look 5. When people say they are pregnant and starving, help get me something to eat!  We live down the street from Mac's and usually visit once a month.  After this experience, I don't know if my fiance or I can ever return.

T-dZd9CBl2QkBvBekzg4Og.text: Don't go in on a Saturday afternoon, you'll never get service.  Twenty people in the dining room and had to wait over 10 minutes for a beer.  We had ordered lunch, but decided to leave.  The bartender nicely comped the beer though.  Used to be a good place, not so much anymore.

-qS7mbsIJRJ3IXbB43ajcA.text: Mac's... you're growing on me! I didn't like you so much at first but now - not only do I love your popular beer selection but your food has gotten better and better. Our party of six enjoyed (truly enjoyed) a burger, the chicken pecan salad, the salmon (yum), the ziti, a patty melt, and the fish/shrimp and chips. Everything was seasoned perfectly and flavored appropriately. Your wait staff even had a smile for us as we messed up our drink orders twice. We messed them up, not her!! Thanks so much for a great evening. We'll be back.

1kmUk-hez4ksW_D7oa6L3A.text: Just stopped in for a few beers with a few friends and we were met with friendly staff, a moderate selection of brews, and a relaxing atmosphere to enjoy each others' company. The prices were reasonable as well. I'll probably be back to try out their menu in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States. Gold Road

yabqs7n8Li1VNEWCkXGyYw.text: Food is always good and thwy have a good selection of beers.  However, the service is lacking.  We went on the Wednesday  before Thanksgiving and we were seated quickly.  Server took our order and brought our drinks. That was the last time we saw her until she brought the bill.  We live in the neighborhood and like a convenient place  to dine, but the service is very inconsistent. Would love to give them a 4 but the service makes it hard.

ZELojvBptsCtEm9GLAs0wA.text: I would give them 5 stars because I have never, EVER had something bad from there. I manage the Baskin Robbins in the same center, and Mac's is our usual dinner to-go place that everyone can agree on.   I wish there was a 4.5 stars, they don't really need to have a 4, but I have to give a 4 because for a "Tap" kind of place, their drinks can be pricey. I would love a large 22 oz option instead of just pints. The pricing of pints can be $4+, but it is specialty beers, not just Miller. I love that they carry Sunbru. Additionally, one time it seems my salad was made by a completely different restaurant! It was odd, just 3 croutons and extremely soaked in dressing... but I've probably had Mac's 50-60 times over the last 4-5 years, which is such a low disappointment rate.    What I get: -BLTTA- Bacon, lettuce, tomato, turkey and avocado... how can you go wrong? I don't eat Mayo so I usually get ranch on it, it's to die for! Probably my most favorite, but I have been trying to cut back on calories so I opt for the salads. -Chicken Caesar Salad (it comes with a sourdough roll which is seriously bomb!) -Chicken Caesar Salad Wrap- one of my favorites -French Onion Soup- good amount of cheese, is always hot and tastes the same every time I get it -The cajun fries are super good but I have to get ranch because I am a wimp. -You can get steak or regular fries, and plain or cajun. All 4 options are good. You can also get fruit which is pretty fresh.  Everyone loves the burgers, but I don't usually eat burgers. I did try one at the Christmas staff party we had there and it was good.   Breakfast is not only good, but inexpensive. I get the egg, bacon and cheese croissant  with fruit, and it's only about $6.  It is a family style tap, so I don't think taking my friends there would be appropriate, which is a bummer because if it probably had a couple more HD TVs and bigger glasses, they would need to expand AGAIN!   Overall: One of my favorite lunch time places, but would definitely go more if it was more of a drinking, not just eating type of place.

2TwReAknihvdX_LQPO2tYQ.text: I want to start this review by saying that I've given this establishment 3 or 4 chances before reviewing it. I realize that restaurants, like people, have off days, but if the experience is a negative one every time I come it no longer is just an off day. I came here to meet with my friend. My friend was coming a bit later so I wanted to place my order. I was completely ignored by my server - he ended up sending another server to take care of me even though the establishment wasn't busy by any stretch of the word. Instead of bringing my food out immediately when it was ready, they waited an extra 30 mins for my friend to arrive and to place his order and bring the food out at the same time. Normally, this would be fine but obviously I wanted my food ahead of time - that's why I ordered it early. The food here is subpar. I've tried something new each time and am lucky to finish half of it. No seasonings and either a stale or soggy bun. We also tried to order drinks, instead our waiter brought out the check. When we tried to correct him saying that we ordered a drink he became argumentative. Save yourself the trouble, go somewhere else. I certainly will.

nRFV5-wGkoWUclX-88GHUQ.text: Not only is the staff some of the friendliest in town, their food rocks.  This not your typical bar food scene.  Everything is fresh, the meat is quality and the drinks are stiff.

iBw6kVpr4LwY8Izxb48MxA.text: I love this place. Have been several times during the week for lunch and always order the grilled cheese sandwich. It is so yummy!! Service has always been good too.

mt3q92_vphjG8wFcRE-UWQ.text: I cannot speak on the whole dining experience, but I got take out from here the other day for an office meeting, and was very satisfied.   Everyone enjoyed their mean, they even wrote the person's name on the box so as everyone got the correct meal. I had the BLTTA (bacon-lett-tomato-turkey- avocado) minus the bacon and it was very tasty. Their cole slaw is a little blah, but the fries, fruit and potato salads all looked very good.   The only hang up was that the person who took my order via the phone, conveniently forgot two of the people on my order, myself included. I had to stand awkwardly int eh bar area waiting for my food to finished. It didn't take long though. I would have appreciated an offering of water or a soda while I waited, but oh well.   I would recommend the food for sure!   I live on the other side of town so i doubt I will be in again anytime soon, but if I were closer I think I would add this to the rotation.

wvwafE4rDH2Tnl0S7nqLgQ.text: tasty food,but service is not good,air conditioner blows the food cold quickly

fbCB_s-6HmHaUWmJ3GA-Og.text: A year+ later and Mac's is consistently good.  Their "burger and beer" special is a nice deal.  It's a place I've come to trust the quality of the food, and I trust the people in the kitchen know what they're doing.  The half dozen times or so that I've ordered a burger medium rare, they've come out a solid medium rare.

1SIEoIpm95EhqWP-4cqmVg.text: We live in the neighborhood and go to Mac's several times a month.  Never have had a bad meal.  Always good food and very friendly service.    Since the recent reviews in the AZ Republic this place has become quite popular.  We don't mind the wait.. and if on occasion the service is slow because they are so busy, we don't worry.  Because the food is always good and the prices are right!  Here is the best part about Mac's.... with two teens in the house this is one of the few places they both agree on for a dinner out.   It is a win win when we eat at Mac's.  If you want to support a locally owned business, staffed by really great folks and dine on terrific food then you need to go to Mac's.  And then tell us all about it!  :)

_MioF9fLnHbLYWojo6Itwg.text: The food is decent and everyone seems to be pretty nice, here.  Nothing very bad to say about the place - if you are looking for a good chicken club sandwich, I would definitely suggest this place.

BqFWgXbYGxYTYgcvhw2d3Q.text: A couple of weeks ago, I had dinner here with friends. I ordered a French dip, without the melted cheese, and a side of fries. The sandwich was excellent. The beef was lean and tender, and the au jus sauce was very good. If I have one suggestion, it would be that they offer a couple of vegetarian options, as I was actually interested in ordering something meatless that day and was not in the mood for pasta. How about a good spicy black bean burger and/or a good lentil loaf entree? These would be two vegetarian options that could fit in well with the menu's comfort food theme. Other than this, I had a good dining experience at Mac's and would come here again. I also love its convenient location near Changing Hands Bookstore. What could be better?

bheBTz3U4v-YR4zWDHDiLQ.text: In my first visit to Mac's,  I had the same experience as many others,  food good,  service terrible. I had the patty melt.   My burger was cooked perfectly,  and grilled onions made the cheese and rye bread taste amazing.   On the service side,  our waitress didn't keep up on our drinks,  didn't offer us napkins or silverware untill after she brought our food out,  and my wife's ultimate grilled cheese was cold because it took her so long to bring us our food.   My daughter was the only one who received silverware,  and only because had the scampi linguini,  which she loved,  but it was not mentioned in the menu that the sauce included capers.   Overall I will recommend the food, but beware of the service.

suuQXP0_Pjx_FfA2z6ppvg.text: Visited on a Saturday night with group of about 7. Called ahead and seated fairly quick. Drink orders taken and served relatively fast but dinner took awhile.  Had the Reuben Burger which was served medium as ordered and fairly large order with fries. My wife had the salmon which was overcooked (maybe they meant smoked).  Perhaps done before the rest of our meals and sat on the warmer? Overall food was OK and service kind of slow. I'd go back but since not from here, might look elsewhere first.

wjCXIMeZj9GhGUVURUzjRA.text: It's Mac's! It's your friendly neighborhood bar and grill!  This is a cute little place next to the infamous Changing Hands and Hoodlum's Music. It's pretty inexpensive and decent quality when you realize that you're in a neighborhood bar and grill type restaurant. There's no pretense that it's anything else.   I always get the southwestern shrimp that comes with wild rice and mixed vegetables (which are always great veggies, never overcooked and always fresh). I've had great experiences with sandwiches here - but everyone else has had great luck with whatever they ordered.   It's just a really chill place, and I would come here twice a week if I lived closer. Friendly service, and although sometimes a little slow, it's just a great neighborhood joint.  Also, they have Malibu, so of course I ordered a Malibu and Dr. Pepper because I wanted to relive high school.

WFzYgwosqU0ZM-bwe05jiQ.text: I am surprised at the semi-low reviews for this place. We have been here several times and thoroughly enjoyed it. The baked ziti is phenomenal!!! The sauce has a little spice and a whole lot of flavor; I crave it on a regular basis. They double grind their own meat in house which makes for a wonderful burger. The service has been fine and the atmosphere is nice. This place deserves a solid four stars.

ji_jJ_XLxb1wkTqOG8CXLw.text: Mac's is great. It's a neighborhood joint with fantastic food and a great selection of brews on tap. I highly recommended any steak or salad on the menu. The wait staff and bartenders are very friendly and a lot of fun to talk to. My advice?? Go to Macs

0SS3fKDQDLsvVamqPE8WoQ.text: I want to like Mac's.  I do.  I keep going back hoping that there are changes, but no dice. Food is average (steak, burgers, and fish and chips), but not bad.  Service is sloooooow, which might not be a big deal without kids.  Nice little bar though, so it's a good place to grab a beer after going to Changing Hands.

kb4PLSOwTbch_fBEajZoOQ.text: What a great little family owned restaurant. We just moved into the neighborhood looking for a local restaurant. Not just bar food.  Fresh and very tasty. The service was excellent and our server was knowledgeable, friendly and attentive. Thanks David! The food and you have earned our business! Get the Cajun shrimp!

ASg4mqvUpmyzvnGfniZjzQ.text: After being one of my favorites since they opened their doors, MAC's have lost a lot of its attraction over the past year or so.  What used to be great food, great service and great atmosphere has slipped to mediocre.  The food is not what it used to be and the service is slipping.  I used to come here at least once a week, but now perhaps once a month - hopeful that they will find the original "groove" again..

RjkcU8sGbDCgwZ2LacJ8nA.text: Great Food - Steak Sandwich, Fish & Chips and Potato Skins are our favorites.  Happy People and very friendly bar staff!  Love this place!!!

gUS6_MOMBbDQq63BWLViCw.text: Mac's is a neat little neighborhood bar and grill in the best shopping center in Tempe:  home of Changing Hands Bookstore and Trader Joe's.     Food is often slow to arrive but the nice selection of brews and attentive staff make the wait worthwhile.

nIytpUxdRQzFeVdV5vMLmQ.text: Pretty solid 3 star place.  Atmosphere is meh.  The decor is pretty hodge podge and clearly not done professionally. We were seated at a booth with ripped up seats in a really weird spot next to the servers station. Our waitress was awesome and really helpful with drink selections. They've got a nice selection of beers, and the lemon drop was perfect. The Reuben sandwich was delicious with tons of flavor. The sweet potato fries were ok but not great. We'll come back but it's not at the top of our list. Also, lame that they don't have pac12 network to watch ASU football.

aauXa_LZ9t6Wq49YhKa3Tw.text: Best burgers in the valley! Freshly ground beef, soft fresh bun, and great toppings! This is the best place to go for a burger. (Disclaimer: I haven't tried any other food there)

qMYRIFC0jhlbKqRliM8rKQ.text: I always love coming here! It's a great family-friendly place! I love their house sherry dressing and they have great beers on tap.  Enjoy!

Ql6IROLnPbgSmmPXIfUtfQ.text: Burgers are GREAT!  We come here just for them.  Each of us have our burger cooked to order differently and they are spot on with our requests.  New server Justin is very attentive.  Food delivered promptly and our drinks were always full.  We will be back.

4taLR2NF9m8dgQA4GVUuXw.text: Mac's food is awesome. I had a bacon burger and fries. My kids had mac and cheese. BUT, every time I've been here the service is so slow. The waitress brought the kids coloring books and crackers to start (thank goodness) but we never got our drinks and waited and hour (after we ordered) for our food... and she forgot the mac and cheese. It also took nearly 15 minutes for her to take my card and pay my bill... if I had cash I would have dropped it and left... with three kids under four (by myself) I didn't have time for a two hour lunch!

q3eCQjeBkU3KaJzvbr_TFQ.text: The original fish and chips with fries $12 tasted old deep-fried process. When you walk into this place right away you know it makes its money of the liquor tab I was a little apprehensive but I said give it a try. But let me cut to the chase The food Sucks.. the booze was great the service was phenomenal! There Tapitio hot sauce tasted funny!

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States. Tapitio sauce should not look this dark it&#39;s usually a bright red. And the flavor from this bottle was disgusting!!

8BGOK3jVdVHDasi40RaLfw.text: Had an apple cider bacon and cheddar (half pound) burger and added jalapenos. I've always had good food here but I felt the burger plus the amount of cheese made this a bit too greasy. Upside is this is a place that will cook meat including burgers medium rare if you wish. My fries were steak fries and though it said Cajun spice on the menu, they did not seem to have this.   My companion had the Reuben sandwich and side of fruit. Had no complaints and rather enjoyed it, impressed with the size of the sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States. My cider bacon &amp; cheddar burger

gz6bLlh7HOv-Mx70p7gqeQ.text: Mac's is a great local owned restaurant. The staff is friendly and attentive, and the service is quick. The food is tasty and fresh. Going to Mac's feels like going to a friends house.

qUJdbYMgUZcCE8SbuSZwoA.text: Terrible. Lousy service, seat cushions were ripped. Not just one, several. The place was just dirty. I can't believe health inspector hasn't given them violations. Time to receive food after ordering was 45 minutes.

BKQXFSDM_ddlTepf_HJuew.text: We keep giving this place one more chance because we once loved it so much. Well, tonight was the end of chances.   It seems the kitchen did not expand when the restaurant did. Food always takes FOREVER. The 3 of us ordered medium burgers and it took 55 minutes to get our food. We got to the restaurant at 6pm. Before the dinner rush. It was not busy. When we finally got our food our sides were ice cold. Our burgers were overcooked and our server was unapologetic. They did remake our fries when we told them they were cold.   All of these things seem pretty minor if they happen occasionally at a place. Unfortunately, this or something similar happens every time we are at Mac's.   We won't be back. An hour is too long to wait for an overcooked burger and cold fries.   Sorry Mac's we want to love you, but we just can't anymore.

XWShOKNVAcVzfI4zXYN4lw.text: Came here for a quick bite to eat with my daughter while we waited for Changing Hands next door to process our donation/ trade credit. Friendly service. Good beer. Good bar food. Nothing spectacular, but still a fun place to hang out!

vEN0LeYa7s9n5XBr1W0AFQ.text: Order the chicken wings and they were undercooked I told my server and right away she fixed the order and I even got a beer on the house I love this place

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States

wtjep2y_JtojA7Ea4fT-LQ.text: Our latest visit could have been far better. We had a new server, which may have been a factor in the disappointing experience. The service was kind but slow. I ordered the "build your own " burger. I was looking forward to an over-easy egg on top but was profoundly dissapointed when it arrived already broken and cooked onto the dishware the burger was resting upon. I resigned to having another beer while waiting for a manager  to appear, eventually having to go to the bar with empty glass in hand to get another round.  Clearly not the level of service thats the norm here.  I paid the tab and left.. very disappointed. A heartbreaking way to begin the weekend.

v440marMhAMZhf0Tv1pmRg.text: Read where this place received either 4 or 5 health code violations lately.  Does anyone know if this place has been re-inspected??

bBEbbyN_2PSphGAxPNHNZw.text: I used to be a regular visitor to Mac's. Actually used to work in the complex and would visit Jesse the guy bartender/server regularly. He was awesome! After a substantial amount of time passed, I revisited Macs. Underwhelmed with my overall experience would be an understatement. I waited about 8 minutes to be greeted by the bartender (which never happened, even though she was behind the bar for about 7 minutes of that time) thin brunette didn't catch her name because I ended up moving to a table in hopes of quenching my thirst... Let me be clear the server that I had was great, (shorter, very curly black hair) she was polite prompt and personable. However after taking my drink order and ringing it in it took the bartender 5 minutes to even grab the ticket off the printer and another 4 for it to get to my table because the bartender spent three minutes talking and finally decided to pour my beer for me. Corey dropped by my table while I was waiting for my beer to arrive, had a great conversation with him, really nice guy with a good beer knowledge we talked about a recent trip I had taken to Washington and some craft beers. Unfortunately his was the only name I caught, I wish I knew my servers name so that I could sing her praises. More than that I wish I had the bartenders name. If the Mac's owners ever read these let me give you one piece of advice. Your spectrum of employees is either amazing or awful. There is no in between. I hope that the next time (if there is one) I return to Mac's I am not greeted (even though I never was) by the same bartender, she made my overall experience awful and I will give Mac's one more chance before I cross it off my list of possible destinations forever. Until the awful portion of the staff is no longer employed it will be few and far between visits that I make to Mac's

eohCvjp6roQtMrPGwCI_8A.text: I would not have chosen to go to Mac's on my own.  But since I was dragged there, I went with an open-mind.  I've driven past many times but never felt any urges to check it out.  As I have guessed it's not the "Mac-daddy" kind of restaurant. It's a neat spot, drinks are good and their chicken quesadilla was the best I've had in a long time.  Though I took a risk and venture outside of my "tastebud-zone," I would probably not go again. No harm, no foul, just not what my palate desires.

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States. Gumnation

O9ut6vsMXZ4fuC2M4h69tg.text: Waited over 30 minutes for our drink order, at least two tables were seated after us and they were served. Had a time crunch, but they couldn't accommodate our food order either.

_cefUbN3mjDDYyjxpKkzlw.text: Stopped in for lunch with my friend yesterday & the food was so delicious! The bartender was awesome! I can say this will be a place I will return often!

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States. Delicious steak burgers &amp; chicken sandwich

sQHJ6w8McnjubTiTTJ5joQ.text: Best grilled cheese sandwich ever! Steak fries are amazing. Tried for lunch as wildflower was packed.

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States. Grilled Cheese

_1-a8kV-5kAcq2ZOz5CY6w.text: A good friend lives right around the corner from this area and when I'm at her house, we frequent here.  The food is consistently delicious and the service each time is great.  situated in a Tempe strip mall, the atmosphere is such; but the food and service have always been consistent.  Yesterday I got the hot pastrami on rye sandwich special and I didn't eat dinner because it was so large and filling. The pastrami was delicious and salty with a unique mustard and ooey gooey cheese.  Tons of crazy delicious black and tan onion rings made with dark beer and an ale made for a great surprise.  Those things were delish!  They also have a solid beer list, and being a beer snob that is important to me.  They don't have a ton of TVs if you are looking to watch a game, but the patio is open and spacious.

cHAftIxhE1u7j0sWlunuQQ.text: They seem to have sanitary issues. Tables are sticky, I've been served rotten lemons, rotten salsa, and rotten cheese. Service, what service? The food had been pretty good in the past, but they have been seriously declining. I've complained several times and even returned optimistically hoping to see improvements. I've witness employees drinking on the job on several occasions. My husband is allergic to cheese, when his order came out with cheese on it, we simply asked for it to be re-made. Our server was actually very polite and helpful, the owner was the one with questionable practices. Even knowing my husband was allergic, he simply washed the cheese off and tried to serve it to me again. That was the last straw. We do not plan on retuning and would not suggest this place to friends. I strongly encourage others to pay careful attention to what they are served there as well.

UcLYdAiGVJzYgzTYmTWPrQ.text: Sat for 1 hour waiting for food.  Took forever to get order taken and same to get drinks.  That should've been our cue to leave.  No apology. Never again.

tMZ56AGhaOmiwPYZOBJmpQ.text: After two visits, I wrote a very negative review on here, which I ended up deleting. I just hate to throw servers and staff under the bus. But in hindsight, this place deserves a negative review.  My second visit was for lunch on a weekday (June 2016). I had the day off, which turned out to be a good thing, because being served lunch took an hour and twenty minutes total. If your restaurant is mostly empty, there is no excuse for this. Your job is to get the lunch crowd in and out. And if there is no crowd, well, we should be in and out even faster. The delays were a complete mystery. Surely the time was not spent on food prep. Please see my photo of the pathetic Buffalo Chix sandwich that finally arrived (Mmmm. Shredded iceberg lettuce and a lame bun with blue cheese glop).  I can only guess that the entire staff is family. They'd all be fired if they weren't. The highlight was a kid wandering the restaurant, endlessly wiping tables which he had just wiped down minutes before. Yes, like a total m**h head. He'd repeatedly ask the few customers present (myself included) "You okay?" As if there was anything he could do to improve the situation except continue to polish the finish off of your table.  Sadly, this spot is almost par for the course as far as casual "American" style restaurants in Tempe go. But almost any competitor is a better choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States. Come on in! And wait. Eventually someone wanders up to the abandoned host station like they are confused about why you came in.
Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States. Possibly the worst Buffalo chicken sandwich ever made.

q4qVwJo9K8uVQ7ykXt3PQQ.text: Don't waste your time. We've been here a few times and today was just the nail in the coffin. I tried to email them directly about our experience thinking we could talk to someone with authority, (because the manager today was so rude and didn't help us at all) but their "feedback" email they have listed on their website comes back as undeliverable multiple times. So, here I am to do everyone else a favor. Spend your money somewhere else, ANYWHERE else.   My mom's food was cold when it should've been hot. It took 45 minutes to get our food. They weren't busy... but we had to track down our waitress to ask about our food because she ignored us up until then.   It's less about the food being cold, but the way it was handled. Or lack thereof. The waitress offered to bring my mom new bread (is she supposed to make her own sandwich?) and when we asked for a manager, some lady (she didn't introduce herself, she only said "I heard there's a problem here.") offered to bring new bread as well. My mom said she felt her food was cold because it took so long for us to get our food and it had been sitting out. The "manager" literally only said, "I'm sorry you feel you waited that long." (Backhanded apology?) And walked away never to be seen again. Then NO ONE talked to us. We were never given a refill on our drinks, we weren't even acknowledged again, except by the waitress who was helping the table next to us. She came up finally and asked if we wanted boxes and refills and apologized for our experience. I'm sorry she was the only positive part of the experience we had.   The food is mediocre at best, cold (when it should be hot) and in a time when service is the only thing that sets businesses apart, this place is not worth anyone's time or money. Wish I could've talked to them directly, but they apparently would rather this be posted on Yelp for everyone to see.

alYRT2UkhKO3e1jwMWTTRA.text: Good food mate. Not many American food places that I can still enjoy but this one is f*ckin flame

IM28vjqthX_pY2bq1iBRnQ.text: I took a look at the menu and ignored some of the reviews to come to my own conclusion.  I have a pretty picky bunch so the range of food was exactly what we were looking for.  They weren't full by any means, but it seemed to take a while to be sat.  The staff was pretty slow and negligent - drink refills went unnoticed and doing other tasks seemed more important than checking on the customers (it wasn't just us).  Our food didn't seem fresh out of the kitchen when it finally arrived and on a school night, I had hoped to be home sooner.  I really wanted this place to be a new regular for us, but it just didn't happen.  That's okay - plenty of places to dine in the area.

quAP2XJDL-3sG_GvBTlbOA.text: When to Mac's about 6 months ago, got a burger and a beer. Burger was pretty decent, service was a little slow. Went back last week, it was moderately busy, (60% occupied) and well staffed. We waited 15 minutes to be given water and menus. We just walked out. Went to the pizza place next door. We were instantly greeted with water and menus and the pizza was awesome. Will not return to Mac's.

83OUBrAHNSKowVpB4eNsWg.text: The couple of times I've been here the food has always been great. It attracts an older crowd and it has kind of a run down vibe but it doesn't take away from the quality of their food and their service. I wish I remembered the name of my server, she definitely deserved a shout out.

FhUa5FMWEvO2aIbSZuNicg.text: Great food within walking distance. This is one of our regular go to dinner joints. Love the fish sandwich with Swiss cheese!  Or a burger.

0VZ0nicW_5RPsd-oRwg02g.text: We used to really like eating at Mac's but last night was terrible. The service was lousy through no fault of the waitress, the food was no very good and the coleslaw was actually rancit. If they want to improve they need new management because the present management is not doing a good job.

S5YCKqaaHc1aoNYgIBgXmA.text: Attention Mac's: Never tolerate a racist in your establishment.    Went to Mac's today with my wife for a cold brew and snack.   Left with a disgusting earful of a tolerated racist customer.   Very Old dude who was in the service and wants to spout his racist agenda.   Told him to stop ...  he did, but then my kind wife felt sorry for him and in some further short comments he still laced in the N word and other vulgar items.    The bartender seems apologetic, but took no action.    I called the manager and here is why I won't go back ever and neither should you:  the manager stated 'he gets like that sometimes'.   So a regular drunk racist is welcome over and over to Mac's, because he spends $?   Or other?    Don't tolerate a racist ever or spend your $ at a place that welcomes racist.

t38-DUaX6fftr4u0EX6dSg.text: My vote for best neighborhood hangout! My favorite is their Blackpepper Bluecheese burger, wonderful. And a draft from a local brewery. This had been my family's favorite place for many years!

b4pMNSNVCxVqW__cPHf6rQ.text: This place is disgusting. I have seen inside the walk in cooler where they store all the vegetables and raw meats and they had raw chicken juice leaking into the top of the unused beer kegs...if you have a draft beer here, chances are you are consuming some raw chicken juice too.  One of the managers smells like she hasn't showered in over a month and she is beyond rude.  I highly recommend staying away from this place.

Y3_PRopAZJYSao2CyQHUPw.text: I got the blue cheese peppercorn with chipotle mayo and an egg, cooked medium. Lemme tell y'all: damn, damn, damn. So damn good. The burger was excellently seasoned. & I mean excellent. It came with fries & chose the Cajun steak fries - again phenomenal & seasoned really well. A+ for the food.  Come get a burger here!

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States. I got the blue cheese peppercorn with chipotle mayo and an egg, cooked medium.

rbfR5okFgBz8GeiCh_dZwg.text: This was by far the best sandwich/burger place around. They made me a sangria from scratch and were so so warm and welcoming. My boyfriend and I will be back here in like the next couple days for sure. Come check them out!! Yum!

gDKygRJ4vWgOp4e2po3FlQ.text: Had a burger and beer today for lunch. VERY slow service: to take our order, to bring the food, the check. It was not at all crowded, tho. I ordered a blue cheese burger. The menu says it has crumbled blue cheese. It had a small amount of cheese inside the patty, but NO cheese otherwise. I ordered it cooked "medium".  The Patty was well-done on half, and rare on the other half. I guess it was "medium" mathematically, but not in the way I ordered!  Must have been on the edge of the grill?

oyDRAjWuvnjpNFeJ5yiIbQ.text: Been here twice. Both times service was extremely slow. We were there 2 hours both times due to the slow service. And they were not busy. This past time they took over half an hour just to come take our order! Then two of the orders were wrong. Didn't bring the food out at the same time so some of us had food 5 min before others. And this wasn't even due to wrong orders. They just brought out whatever whenever it was done instead of waiting until all the orders were ready. Overcharged for one wrong order and never got correct bill. Just left the amount it was supposed to be. Water never refilled. Bathroom flooded. Overall, just not a good experience. Once I can maybe understand. But slow, poor service twice? Nope. We'll go somewhere else next time.

TPlBVniv0yy6vS55cTuqYg.text: Have been to Macs a couple of times, decent food with a lacking atmosphere. Think bar restaurant in a cafeteria setting.  Had a bad meal today, maybe a one off, but less than decent. Went with a couple of friends, I ordered the ribeye, medium rare.  The food order took 25 minutes to get to our table. My steak was easily medium well, an obviously not a ribeye, very likely the sirloin cut they offer. Service was sub-par; no questions about how the food was, or prepared to our liking.  Did not see the waitress again until plates were ready to be cleared. No questions at that time either about my meal, even though 80% of my steak was left and cleared away. The vegetables and steak fries were very good though.  Probably a two and a half star place, but.... atmosphere, service and food all missed the mark.

4RLir0MEsP2qlNqW410fzA.text: We came here for a girls afternoon before getting a our nails done, and we were treated horribly. Not sure if our waitress was having a bad day, but she was downright rude.  I ordered a cup of soup and a baked potato...which one would think during the lunch hour would be relatively quick.  Thirty minutes later she said that she could have the cook poke his fingers into the potato to see if it was done or not?  Really, I didn't even want to eat it.  She also rudely interrogated my friend on what she wanted to drink, but since their drink menu was non-existent, how are we to know what you have?  Sorry for asking questions.   After finally getting the food, which was disappointing at best, the waitress just stomped around like a little baby who wasn't getting her way. Sorry, there are plenty of other places that are more than willing to take my money.  We'll go next door next time.

k3HbBhrjPsSf9VvB7_QGpg.text: Mac's food is like, WHOA. Their taps change out frequently which I also appreciate. This is a great neighborhood bar with above average food. I mean, it's delicious. Their burgers....pshhh...yeah, do it. We switch what we try nearly every time because nothing disappoints. If you're driving through the area definitely pop in to here at least for a beer and an app. They have a small bar that fills up fast with regulars and I totally understand why. The servers and bar tenders are always fantastic and usually pretty entertaining. Great spot!

8oVhs091NOQmaUrzkVoNJQ.text: Mac's is the True example of a place to go if one is looking for great customer service, very friendly staff, tastey craft beers, well prepared food, and just an all around amazing experience. Hanging out with the chill and relaxed neighborhood gang having great discussions while the mild rock and roll tunes play in the background is one of my absolute favorite things to do a couple times a week.

fnz8L-Xzh2jYOrcrfNirfQ.text: Great mom and pop owned resturant, serves breakfast on the weekends for a very reasonable price and lunch and dinners are delicious. Great beer selection and friendly atmosphere. Great place to stop by for a lunch and a few brews.

jREfNUarLldgq3-wbVROPQ.text: Best bloody Mary's in town! (ask for grown up glasses!) Awesome food at great prices, the service is slow, but way faster than it was before.  It's worth the wait, and best value for your buck!

_-tGT6WCP2PmNCFfv6AU1Q.text: I was at Mac's this Sunday for breakfast. I wanted to take my mom somewhere in Tempe for her birthday where we could have a relaxing breakfast and some mimosas. The breakfast menu was pretty short and offered NOTHING in the way of healthy. I understand it's a "bar" but I expected some oatmeal or something light I could snack on. Regardless, I did order the short stack pancakes with bananas and they were yummy (not healthy but worth it) and my mom's eggs benedict were tasty as well.  Our server was SUPER friendly and helpful! My issue was the $5 per mimosa, I asked several times to go light on the OJ but everyone came out the same, a little more than half filled and still heavy on the OJ. I drink out often enough to know my monies worth on alcohol and 3 half filled mimosas later I felt neither a slight buzz nor satisfied, neither did my mom (and she is a light weight!). In general I like this place and have good experiences but in the future will look somewhere else to have breakfast and a mimosa.

2MoF3DKZQeJJ4g_ZDVKlIg.text: I just got back from lunch at Mac's. Since I work near by, we usually frequent this place 2-5 times a month. Once again it rocked as usual. I always go for the spicey roast beef so that would by my recomendation if you haven't been here before or if you have been here and haven't tried it. Their food is served with a very generous portion of fries (I prefer seasoned) and even those are better than most of the other bar/grill type eateries. Thanks Mac's!! See ya in a few days.

oOiWU0UyrBO8pW7KOS7dEg.text: Absolutely my fave local spot. I can always count on delicious fries (regular, cajun, steak, cajun steak), awesome burgers, and a completely delish grilled cheese sandwich (swap out the tomatoes for avocado). With great customer service, this genuine neighborhood bar and grill has a fantastic atmosphere and probably the best wing sauce in town. LOVE IT!

UpiBL3Na7q1iteBWmSRGrw.text: I got there about 6:30pm with my fiance and my son. After 20 minutes of being ignored, I left. On our way out, someone finally came over.

0YeXFTkV3TpOSI0qyOJqTQ.text: A lot of reviewers wrote about Mac's as if it were a bar (or not a whole lot more than bar).  Yeah, there is a bar, but, I've been there many times -- sometimes once a week -- and for the most part the people sitting at the bar are conversational and mindful that there are a lot more people there to eat breakfast, lunch, or dinner.  (Mostly the latter two if your agenda is sitting on a bar stool for a while.)  Once, a guy was totally bombed and, well, a complete jerk.  But just once.  If you haven't been to Mac's in quite a while, they have doubled in size (the bird feeder store next door closed ... sad).  But, Mac's now holds twice as many diners, the wait staff has never been slow for me, the prices are great, and I've tried most menu items and each one was delicious.  So don't discount Mac's as a dive bar.  It's a restaurant; like many, yeah, there's a bar and a choice of TVs with sports games showing.  But that's really a small portion of the place.  Go for the food and the wait staff who remember you each time you visit (or that you haven't swung by in a while).  Mac's is outstanding among south Tempe's offerings.

V0KgXETp12jiinhcY8CJEg.text: We visited Mac's for the first time tonight.  I'd often wondered how it was, but it's nearly impossible to lure my husband away from the ceasar salad at Wildflower.  But this weekend, Mac's is participating in Hoodstock and donating 10% of it's proceeds to my stepdaughter's school, so we gave it a try.    We waited for about 15 minutes for a table, but were able to get a snack for our girls and a couple beers while we waited.  Toddler meltdown averted.  RIght when they seated us, some friends of ours came in, also looking to have dinner.  We asked if our table could accommodate three more people and another baby, and since it couldn't they opened a bigger table for us in the back.  Pretty cool, if you ask me.  Once we ordered, it took a while for our food to get to us.  In their defense though, I think they were pretty slammed with additional business coming in from Hoodstock next door.  I ordered the spicy roast beef, my husband had the a California chicken sandwich (something along those lines) and our girls split some fish and chips (hold the chips, sub a side of fruit).  The spicy roast beef is no joke.  Now, I'm no stranger to spice.  I like my wings HOT, I add extra tabasco to my bloody Mary's, hell, I ate hot sauce straight out of the bottle when I was pregnant.  But this sandwich took it overboard.  Heat can be a good thing, but not when it's the ONLY THING you can feel in your mouth.  I couldn't even taste anything else in the sandwich.  Finally, I picked off the jalapenos and it was much more tolerable.  My husbands chicken sandwich was great, and the girls fish was mediocre.  Not the best, not the worst, but pretty good.  I'm not a fan of skinny little french fries.  There's just not enough potato for me.    But, the service was fine, considering it was a packed house with big parties and lots of kids in there.  And I have to give them props for donating money to Broadmor.  Next time we're in the area and in the mood for some eats and drinks, we'll stop in again.

jAP_EiSAz9r3q7o3ZGAS8g.text: i also wandered over to this patio after peeking in at Wildflower on a Sunday morning and seeing a long line and no tables. i would have waited but my guest would not. so we walked out and right over to Mac's.  feeling like a traitor, i decided to go for lunch, not breakfast, cause, you know, that's me and Wildflower's thing. i had an uninspired chicken salad sandwich with cajun fries that were coated in so much red flakiness i should have had a finger bowl like they use for rib eatin'. dad had corn beef and hash. he ate it, no comment on it, so imagine it was average or below. the patio is decent sized... service was ok. i probably won't go out of my way to come back.

dSgJ2t9wL-L36nQzKSibbA.text: Mac's is my local "go to" spot.  I've been a customer for years now and it's the standard Sunday morning meet up spot.  The breakfast is great (although they changed their bacon recently and need to go back to the other one) and the BLTTA is fabulous!!  Nice variety of dishes so you're bound to find something to fit whatever you might be craving.  So, in easy to read bullet points here are the pro's and con's: Food - Great! Never had bad food here but of course haven't tried everything.  Portion size is more than adequate for the price. Service - super nice but yes...sometimes a bit slow.  Of course they occasionally surprise me with breakfast before I get thru 1/2 of my Bloody Mary! Music - they play older rock and have decorated the walls with album covers.  Way cool!
