Booze - Good beer selection (Four Peaks, Kona & standards.  Super Bloody Mary's!  I get double, spicy w/extra limes! Atmosphere - casual and a very local neighborhood hangout feel. Wi-fi - they don't have it but sometimes if the breeze blows just right...you can get a decent signal from nearby Wildflower. Kid friendly - i suppose but why bring them?  :-)  Happy Hour - basic happy hour prices but the board will announce daily specials. Specials - They always seem to have the burger and a pint special for about $9.  I recommend the burgers!!  Yum!  I hope you try it and have the same great experience I do.  Just don't make it 'your' local hang out too or I'll never find a table at happy hour!  This place gets busy!!  Cheers!

cI7FkXKWHYv_Q2nBjcJj5A.text: I really really wanted to like this place. We have been looking for a close local bar & grill in Tempe with good draft beer choices, good food and a comfortable atmosphere. We got there early (around 5 for dinner) and pretty much had the place to ourselves. The server was friendly and sweet, and pretty attentive but....and this is the main issue...the food was pretty awful. I ordered a patty melt which turned out to be a thin, dry hamburger with a few onions on top and very bland cole slaw. My husband tried a steak (over cooked for his med-rare order) and once again, bland potatoes and veggies. Overall nothing to rave about. Darn. We live in Tempe and like to spend our money in Tempe establishments, but I guess it is back to Chandler and Teakwoods!

lZFqdVaocIq8SWt8kW4C6w.text: This is one of our go-to restaurants.  It's a great neighborhood spot where we are comfortable bringing our family.  I only order burgers and beer and they're always excellent.

qgZJgkJEp4A-9_Yt9ItANA.text: I have yet to have an unpleasant experience here. Besides the fantastic beer options, everything I have ordered from here I enjoy from salads to sandwiches and pasta. I mean a nice tasty cheeseburger with fries(or salad if you choose to avoid fried objects) and a pint of beer for $9. How can you say no? I just wish it was open a little bit later.

KOELJlhOR7Ckd60QlClq3w.text: Food was tasty  - chicken salad and alfredo pasta.  No drinks.  Way casual atmosphere.  Waitress took her time, but wasn't unpleasant.  I wouldn't go out of my way to come here again, but it's fine if you are hungry and in the neighborhood.

3TwUHTUg31P0rfBqeOQc3A.text: Mac's is one of our favorite neighborhood places for a bite to eat. Nothing fancy, but the food is always good and reasonably priced, and no one cares if we split an entree. Don't know about the entrees, but the sandwiches and fries are great, and so are the soups. We go to Mac's at least once a week.

Kb0dFv6MQlDXbj9OcrHaPg.text: Great place, family owned, great food, friendly staff.  Lots of variety on the menu, something for everyone.  Only tried breakfast once, but the beef chorizo burrito was delicious.  When busy, the food may take a bit longer than other places, but again, you're supporting a local owned business and not a chain.  Enjoy!

uLxblq7YzmYAcSubmUIH6g.text: This place has a wide variety of food for extremely reasonable prices.  You can get a delicious and huge meal with a beer cheaper than most places definitely.  They have a really good bar with beers like sunbru, kiltlifter and smithwicks on tap.  Good salads, REALLY good burgers and fanastic sandwitches.  It definitely gets busy sometimes and they aren't always perfect, but I've been to Macs probably 50 times and I think its great.  I also know the owners and they are fantastic people, who are usually working hard at something on the premisis.

aJ2o21rCH4cpHodonUCN1w.text: Frankly, I think I would find a more enjoyable meal from the dumpster down the street. Clearly NOTHING is homemade, the dessert I ordered was still frozen in the center...YUM.  And where do I start with the service...I don't...there is not enough space alloted here to properly express the disappointment.  When my server was not ignoring me, she made up for it by being extremely rude. When I asked to speak to the manager...she told me her "DAD" was not available???!!!!   What a SHOCK!!!!   Steer clear of this dive.

UbMHafF0h_ElFVfwnQpKAg.text: BEST Burgers in the Valley!! Great people that work there, and they always have great beers on draft. The spicy beef sandwich is superb, as well - Full of flavor! Happy Hour is always fun and full of fun people! One of the BEST places to eat in the entire valley!

LZoAmJz7Zp774gyk7TSW8g.text: Horrible service, we were there for almost 2 hours. It took so long for our food, it wasn't even busy when we got there. I ordered a cheese burger well. It came out about 40 minutes later still mooing. I told the waiter about it, he said he would take care of it. He came back with it and you could tell someone just through it in the microwave to cook it the rest of the way. It was nasty. Everyone else liked their food but they said they would not come back because of the service. I wish I could remember that waiter's name. I hope he doesn't make waiting tables a permanent profession.

uKCxOuBjOPCnM-9SCgMmtA.text: They have totally bomb a$$ cobb salads.  Today my husband had maple glazed pork chops and I had the surf and turf.  Delish!   BTW it came with soup or salad and they're made fresh here.   We had to meet the cook, Dion, just to congratulate him.  And our server, Alice, was so sweet.  Thanks for making our Friday pleasant!

Y_BZ7lZNsqe4ZitO47fkUA.text: I cannot believe that I've never been here before! Shocking really. My friend has been here many times and says it is consistently good. We came for lunch and we were not let down.  The food was very good indeed.  Our service was also very good .  The interior needs of the bit of a spruce up though. All the seats in the booth were split and the stuffing exposed. I find that kind of disgusting.  If you wearing something delicate it would rip it .   We got a chicken, pecan salad. It was fantastic, large enough for two people to split. We  also got the coconut shrimp which came with vegetables and rice. We also split that item, also wonderful. There was still enough after two of us dining to take leftovers home.   Great food, great service, the interior just need a little make over , the bathroom was semi-clean.

qdcLU5DyyzBB6lxWYt3kjA.text: Warm beer, $6 for 2 below average kids chicken strip and a, "delicious" buffalo chicken sandwich the waitress swore by. If I wanted a low quality grilled chicken breast drenched in franks red hot on soggy bread, I would have made it at home.  Spend your money elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States. Kids chicken strips, minus one eaten strip.
Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States. Kids chicken strips, minus one eaten strip.

LXJCialFye431mEjEavB4w.text: Mac's has all the makings of a good neighborhood bar, except it falls short.  If you read my previous review, I really detailed all the great things about Mac's.  Unfortunately, the things I don't like are getting worse and outweighing the great things.  THE UPDATED STORY  The specialty drink menu is mostly gone. The bartender explained that it was more expensive to maintain the specialty drinks than were ordered. Fair enough, but that's one of the things I liked.  The food menu has fewer selections. Their menu of home cooking was one of the things I liked. Although, I did try the fried zucchini and it was actually outstanding for fried zucchini.  SERVICE EXPERIENCE  But the real issue at Mac's is the UNBELIEVABLY LONG WAIT FOR EVERYTHING.   I just can't understand why it consistently takes FOREVER to receive anything, especially food items.   The waitress explained that they make each item to order and that there is little done in advance. But it still doesn't explain it. And I'm sick of trying to figure out why.   I notice in the reviews that other people have been experiencing the same issues.  CONCLUSION  I still go there if I know I'm in absolutely zero rush and don't expect anything special to happen.  It's disappointing to give a poor review, since it has such potential.  OVERALL SCORE: 18/25 STAFF: 4 FOOD: 4 SERVICE: 3 CLEANLINESS: 4 PRICE: 3  3/5 RECOMMEND  OF NOTE  * Plenty of Free Parking * Hours Mon  8:30AM-9PM Tues 11AM-9PM Wed 11AM-9PM Thu  11AM-9PM Fri    11AM-10PM Sat    9AM-10PM Sun   9AM-9PM

deMR0_YiHLM4HOliRekoWg.text: What happened??  It's permanently closed?    I guess I should not be surprised. For the past year the service has gotten really bad and we wondered why the old crew were suddenly replaced. From reading the other reviews it must have been new management.  However, I would like to know what happened.  We usually went there for the most delicious hamburgers, the best in town so I thought, and the Salmon Caesar salad as well as other dishes but those were my go to favorites.  I'm really going to miss our neighborhood favorite pub. Very sad.

b_w56c4o_AvSRYUugn9ASg.text: I come here once every couple years as a reminder that I really don't like it here. This time we came in on a Tuesday night. Despite only a few tables being full, it took ten minutes for someone to take our drink order. Fifteen minutes after that our server came back to take our order. I indicated I was a bit annoyed and our server got an attitude about it. We both ordered salads. I got the seafood salad. It took a while for the food to come out. Everything tasted good, but my seafood salad had a lot of water in the bottom of the bowl. There are better places around with decent service. Mac's is fine to grab a beer, but I think we're done trying to eat here.

NSBFoPX_k6tx5mfyWoahEw.text: Very poor service, we were seated and nobody came by for over ten minutes and we left.

yimW2EsqKg7KtW71nUZKdQ.text: Wasn't acknowledged for 20 minutes and then when I said something to a guy mopping he just kept mopping. Nope! We left. Awful customer service Mac's.

v3lDdqWb3dRu8TpJdTt68Q.text: We love this place!  It's rare to find such an awesome and well enjoyed neighborhood establishment... The service is efficient and friendly, the food and drink always the highest quality and the location-perfect! Every time we stop in, we get consistently fantastic service.

ONzHg_PAQw7UAo5Dt3irxw.text: Used to love this little bar and grill. The owner is usually here, and in the kitchen. Good food, good burgers. Two stars are for the former potential.  But since the current bar manager came on the scene in the past year or so it has gone seriously down hill and now it barely rates a 1 -- staffing a restaurant is a tricky business, and this place lost the recipe. Too bad.

-pKseEDfeX0f9FWRshsU8g.text: I've driven by several times and was tempted to stop in but then I finally did. Great place super low-key the bartender was above excellent, great conversationalist and attentive. It was pretty quiet and I couldn't ask for anything more. I wasn't hungry and it made me kind of sad because  the food smells delicious. I will most definitely return to eat as well:)

POyFcyrTV-j3iOUhtxu8KA.text: I've been to Mac's twice for lunch and had a great experience both times.   On my first visit I dragged the lunch crew from work with me and we all had a good experience. I tried the special, which was the honey-kissed fried chicken, served with homemade mac 'n cheese with slaw. The chicken was amazing! I have to say, the portion they served was huge! I didn't eat dinner after putting this meal down.   On the second visit I had Mac's Fish Sandwich. This is a nice alternative to the typical breaded and fried fish patties you are probably used to. Worth trying.   Service was great on both visits. The staff was very friendly and quick to take our orders, delivering our food without issues - like some other reviewers have reported.   On one of my next lunch visits I need to try one of their burgers. I've heard nothing but good things about them from everyone else and menu offers a lot of different options. A happy hour may also be in my near future here. They have a really nice selection of beers and drinks to pick from.

e2v3T8oARcryDAHHd-x6xw.text: From the greeting at the door to paying our tab.  The experience was top notch.  Food was great, service was outstanding.  We will make this a regular spot.  Try the hamburgers is a must.

Ia-sgeNjxU4bbWktBnL4ug.text: My friends and I came in craving a good burger and we left satisfied! Our waitress was attentive and accurate.

wR0sagSPdnMfbj-LT6DilQ.text: What has happened to Macs. We actually went back for a second chance and could not believe the decline. The food is average but pricey. The service is horendeous no fault of the only two waitresses busting tail trying to keep up and the atmosphere needs alot of work even though they fixed their booths apoulstery since we were there last time. We used to love Macs and have gone there for years. It is now crossed off the list.

XoO2wO9koVkLHAh05PgiPA.text: I have stopped into this venue twice before an appointment in the shopping center. The first time to say the service was Gruff is an understatement. I waited 15 minutes to be served at the bar although there was a bartender present and the place was not busy. Yesterday I stopped in again and waited 10 minutes and although there were three service people in and around the bar, I was not even acknowledged and left without ordering. Am I invisible? I don't think so, but I don't appreciate the vibe at all.

Ogz55ag1LECcWV7eeODq9w.text: I visited Mac's with my lady friend last evening, a Saturday night. There were only three or four tables with customers, and maybe five people at the bar itself, so not busy at all by any stretch of the imagination. I used to come here quite a bit a few years back, I now wonder why I should ever bother in the future.  The vacuous and indifferent host, a young man, acted like we were from a 19 century leper colony when we walked in...I imagine we had 'horned in' on his precious Twitter and Instagram activities at a bad time. He gave us menus and said we'd have a waiter 'soon'. Frankly the wait was like watching paint dry on a humid day...any longer and I would be collecting Social Security.   Finally, after about 15 minutes the phantom waitress showed up and said 'hello'...we said 'hi' and, being parched, we asked for water first. That took about another ten minutes...where she went and what she did in the interim was a mystery...maybe she had a casual chat with the help in the back kitchen. Certainly this person was no ball of fire. I hate it when service staff in a public venue act like they would rather be doing their laundry, or maybe scooping dog doo from their back lawn, than just doing their job to the best of their ability.   We were not starving so we ordered one Cobb salad and asked to split it onto a couple of plates. About twenty minutes later we got the salad, which was large and looked tasty...but alas, no plates nor any large spoons or tongs to use to fill the plates. BTW, it took almost ten more minutes just to get the two plates...I think she had to go to the Dollar store across the street to buy them. Forget about getting a large serving spoon or some tongs to divide the salad. It's evident that management and staff have not had any deep Einstein-like thoughts about providing some sorely needed utensils. I think Neanderthals  had more at their disposal to eat their food with.  The food is decent and ample, and the prices are a tad above average for this fare, but the service is so slow it could probably be timed with a sundial from ancient Greece. The owner of this place needs to be proactive and hire some wait staff that actually gives a d*mn about their job, and who act like it when they serve customers who are spending their hard-earned money. Unless Mac's get the incredibly slow and indifferent service straightened out I doubt if I will ever go back to this establishment...there are better places to spend your time and your money.  Steve

_XcXin640Q8N_uiVKL28pg.text: The food was really bad over cooked dry we will never go again service was bad food took 45 min because the forgot my husbands food

kX9zPng4ADYzpnUL_3UGaw.text: Walked in, was seated right away. Server was so attentive and so nice. Even pulled out there old drink menu to give me some options. Food was absolutely amazing! Their chili and French dip are to die for! Will totally be coming back again. Best part, only a mile from home!!

4qkeLH8H2wuoMvFHNikIHQ.text: Yuck.  Even the ranch dressing was bad. The highly recommended fish sandwich was gross and covered in American cheese.  Mimosa served in a wine glass.  Told to walk up to the bar to read the sign if I wanted to know what beers were on tap.  Good news is Trader Joe's is in parking lot so we went there to get ingredients for dinner.

mnCaNIB6WCJOjLuthT8iIQ.text: Being called a Broiler & Tap , you may mistake this place for a bar of some sorts. While the setting is definitely bar-like, with the plasma t.v.'s on the wall and sports theme. Mac's is much better at being a restaurant than anything in my mind. If you're going, make sure it's somewhat early, they close at nine on weekdays and ten on weekends, I believe.  Every time I stop by Mac's I'll order the sourdough chicken melt, which is always delicious. I would branch out for a different entree, but with this one you can't lose. I still wonder if they get their bread fresh from the Wildflower Bread Company next store because it's always so fresh.   They always have perfect, crispy fries and yummy side dishes as well. Sometimes I'll order a glass of Blue Moon, but I prefer to dine at Mac's.    There's not a whole lot of seating inside the restaurant,  but they do have some more seating on the patio (as long as it isn't summertime).   I love the atmosphere here and can't wait to go back there.

dI7yU01rI6gxtPUqbruHuA.text: Great place and food.  Sat out on the patio with large party and had great service and food.  I will go back for sure and see what else they have to offer other than a yummy sandwich.

bKeLTM08uTv9y3vNDXGoWQ.text: My favorite burger joint. When I want a fresh ground beef burger with steak fries on the side this is where I go. They ask how you want your burger cooked so it is just right and  which fries you want. I love being served by Julia Stiles doppleganger or Silent Bob. They do have deals for burger and a beer. Often there are only one or two tables open when we arrive for dinner which is a testament to the popularity. I would take friends from out of town here.

tqBL2mYA2DhLXEP6bOVa8g.text: Mac's is fine for local casual non-chain dining. IMO this is a good substitution for generic chain places like Friday's which is why it merits a recommendation.  They have a cute little patio. The service is a a bit slower than I would like - however the overall experience is pretty good.  Go here for a burger and a beer and you should leave happy.

P6HzywbwzUN5oZtOmB3KRg.text: So first off, I love this place. I'm only giving it 3 stars tho because the service is sooooo SLOW! It's always packed when I go in hungover for brunch on the weekends. Lotsa families - which is fine, but I've never seen a manager or anyone else out on the floor helping those girls out. I've tried a few different things there...from the lunch and the breakfast menu. Everything's always been great. When it comes out an hour later, you're so hungry that I guess it would taste better than usual. They make great bloody marys too.   Overall, it's a good spot if you're patient.

qaVaytfs_C1aMgCmNVoXGg.text: Great for burgers, breakfast, football, or just a weekend lunch with the kids!

nSmVHa9i5EKZAIFtNYaskA.text: This is an absolutely fantastic local restaurant!  The burgers and sandwiches are great; the service is friendly; and the atmosphere is family friendly.  We live nearby and Mac's is a regular stop for us.  We are also fans of their breakfast menu--my personal favorite is the huevos rancheros.  Support a great local establishment!

POngfaKSCwoZHC2mepBtmQ.text: An excellent local restaurant. The regular menu is strong. The daily specials are a different kettle of fish. I have tried several and they are very hit & miss. The chicken Caesar wrap is my favorite. The staff is friendly and welcoming. They remember you when you come back.

hvDcVF6ogdni5KQwjfOTaQ.text: I've heard about this place before, but last night was the first time we went there. We wanted to grab an ice cream nearby at Baskin Robbin's but it was too busy. I mentioned food to the wife, and Wildflower is good but boring (if you go there a lot, like me). We were with our 4 year old and were told we could sit wherever we wanted, so we grabbed a large table in the back (all the booths were taken).   Elizabeth immediately came over to get our drink order. She was oleasant and never stopped smiling. The menu looked fantastic, and because we'd not been there before, we skipped the more expensive specials menu. Burgers are a staple of bar food so I wanted to begin there. I ordered a blue cheese and pepper corn burger with fries, the wife got the Maryland crabcakes, and we ordered the kid chicken fingers and fruit. My wife also got a cup of French onion soup, which came out relatively quickly.   We both love French onion soup, and it was pretty peppery the way I like it, and it was more of a tomato base like she likes. Good for both of us. We asked for the kid's food as soon as possible since it was after 7pm. A short period of time, her battered chicken came out piping hot. We cut it up and the wafting aroma made our mouths water. We both tried a bite the battered breading cover was savory. We're not sure what it was but it was really tasty for fried chicken fingers. The fruit bowl was perfect for a child, and every  single piece looked great.  My burger did take awhile but that's because I always get them well done (can't stand reddish beef). It was more like an angus patty, and well formed. It was a light brown throughout, and the swiss I asked for was perfectly melted and a nice balance between a tasty bite and smooth finish.   My wife was in the mood for seafood when we went out, and she did order the crabcakes, which came with a house tartar that was different than I'd had before. It was a little spicier and richer. That smothered across the cake, with a little of the pickled cabbage from the plate, was to die for. I am not a big crab cake eater and I liked it; the wife said it was the best she's ever had.   The only reason it did not get 5 stars is 1) there is no wireless. I could run business meetings out of this place if it had wireless! and 2) my fries were burnt and terrible. They have those thin ones that get to crispy too fast. They should change to steak fries and I'd be very happy.

pZA2qeHTgiVZRhkPe5QMeg.text: Excellent!  One word is really all that is needed to describe this place. It's a family-owned, cozy restaurant with a bar. Even before they expanded it was still family friendly, now it's somewhere I can go with friends for drinks or with my family for breakfast/lunch/dinner. I used to be a regular back when it opened and I can't believe I forgot about this place. It's the right size, not too big as to be loud, not to small as to have too much difficulty getting a table (at most times- watch out HH). Their happy hour is decent, their food is scrumptious and the staff is amazing! We had drinks on Thursday and then came back on Saturday for some biscuits and gravy last week. They are my new favorite place for biscuits and gravy! And a strong contender for spicy bloody Mary's. I love the wood interior. I think that's what gives it the warm and inviting feeling. Totally a neighborhood upscale restaurant. It's now permanently added as one of my go-to places for meeting people. Thanks Mac's for keeping it the same for so many years! Don't change a thing!

s_9YHv25O3qffciTMneHGA.text: About 2 weeks ago I moved into to an apartment complex that is 1/4 mile away from the intersection of Guadalupe and McClintock. At this intersection there is upwards of 10 different dinner choices, the majority of them chain restaurants or fast food. Being of the "shop local Tempe" mindset, I ventured to Macs Broiler & Tap, a mom and pop joint sandwiched between 2 of my favorite places in Tempe: Hoodlums Music and Changing Hands Bookstore. I figured since it was in such good company, I would give it a go.   I walked in the door and walked to the (empty) hostess stand where a sign read "Please wait to be seated." Being a good drone, I did just that, I stood there looking for the hostess for a good 3 minutes, waiting to be seated. Finally a girl busing tables looks over at me, apparently confused over why I'm just standing there, and says "You know you can just sit where ever you want." So I go and grab a table, situate myself. And I wait. And I wait some more. About 10 minutes later a waitress comes over to me and tells me that she will be right with me. Five minutes later, she comes back and asks if I would like a menu. At this point, I've now been in the place for about 20 minutes. I wanted to say "Yes, that would be just dandy. I would like a menu so i can order some food, which is the reason why I've been waiting 20 minutes." I bite my tongue and just say "Yes, thank you."  The waitress grabs a menu for me, doesn't stick around for me to ask for a drink, and walks away. She returns with a water 5 minutes later, putting it on the table as she walks by, not stopping to ask if I had any questions or want something other than water to drink. By now I've looked at the menu, figured out what I wanted, and wanted to order. I try flagging her down, finally catching her attention, only to get a curt "I'll be there in a moment." She meander's her way over, takes my order, and goes to walk away. I stop her and ask if I can get an iced tea with my meal and the look she gave me had to be akin the one she'd give someone who just demanded her 1st born child, a combination of confusion and incredulity and disbelief.   A bit later, she walks by again, nearly drops my iced tea onto the table (she never stopped walking), and continues on her way without a word. Armed with my glass of water and my reluctantly given iced tea, I began the long wait for my order, the Chicken melt sandwich. Continuing what appears to be the M.O. of Mac's, I waited for my sandwich. And I waited. And I waited. Then, get this:  I waited some more. I waited for over 35 minutes for my food, and not once did my waitress come around to see if i needed more water (i did) or more iced tea (I didn't, but could have used a top off on the glass as it's free refills). Just when I was about to flag the waitress down to ask why they didn't pluck, slaughter, and carve up the chicken into the appropriate parts BEFORE I placed my order, a she walks out of the kitchen with a plate in hand and brings a plate to my table, puts it down and walks away barely saying a word. In front of me is my chicken sandwich.   There was bread, chicken, bacon, cheese, and tomato's. Beautifully, they got my order correct. The cheese was melted, but kind of cold (as if it had been sitting there waiting for someone to bring it to my table), the bacon was very good. The chicken was a bit dry, but by this time, I was starving. All in all I was there for an hour before I got any food, and when I did finally get it, I was not about to voice a complaint and wait even longer. I understand that Mac's is not a fast food joint, nor was I expecting it to be. However, being "Joe, party of One" in a 1/4 full restaurant, I feel that I can expect to receive my food in WELL  under an hour. Hell, just by being by myself I should be in, fed, paid, and out in under an hour. The waitress never checked to see if the food was OK, never offered me refills on my water or tea, and basically pretended I didn't exist. For a local restaurant situated between two of Tempe's best Local businesses, I expected a lot more.   Needless to say, I am sorely disappointed with my experience at Mac's, what with high expectations due to positive reviews on here and from people I know. I never got my waitresses name and was basically treated as a nuisance and not as a paying customer, from the minute I walked in and stood at the empty hostess booth looking like an idiot to the minute I walked out the front door.    Bottom line? I could have gone to Trader Joe's to buy the ingredients, gone home, cooked, ate, and cleaned up in the time I wasted over at Mac's. Will I be returning anytime soon? Probably not.

JXcgAvJdyigQkqTFlmfehQ.text: Great food! I work in the plaza and eat there a lot since the prices aren't bad. Breakfasts are home style and fresh and who doesn't enjoy a bloody Mary in the morning? For lunch I usually get a burger or sandwich, the salmon Caesar is loaded with fish and the cross buns they serve with the entrees is super yummy. The meat is hand cut, ground in house and burgers cooked to order. They have many side options instead of fries. Happy hour is fun out on the patio. The food can take a little while to come out sometimes but well worth it. This is not a chain restaurant were half your food is microwaved. All the food is awesome except I don't recommend the fish sandwich.

f6w5qHw94eBZ9xqA9ip2AQ.text: I shop local when I can, and my little slice of Tempe is loaded with some local success stories including Changing Hands bookstore and Stinkweeds.  Mac's is sandwiched between the two and right across from my favorite national chain, Trader Joes. I like the low-key atmosphere at Mac's, the decent food and nice mix of local patrons enjoying the patio. Unfortunately like so many other establishments they seem to hire really clueless young servers who leave you waiting in the front or are mystified about what you ordered.

U30XXmO6sE2U6Fjbvt3QfQ.text: Good place for beer and good eats. Nothing super spectacular but the salads are good. Have not tried much with the food besides salads and apps, but they have Odell's on tap which makes me happy. Fun little local joint.

6ilXVTmOqkUhd0pkBGtdkQ.text: I'm definitely with you on this one, Bonnie G.! I don't know why so many of my friends liked going here. The beer selection is hit or miss and the food is the epitome of mediocre. Having gone here over a handful of times, I've never seen the same waitresses twice...what's with that? Sure, the prices are cheap and the space is low key, but come on, South Tempe! Avoid the entrees. The more complicated the meal, the more likely they'll mess it up. They've got a deal on a burger and a beer and even that couldn't get me in the door.

GgHPLKICl6l4XvwcW3Ajbw.text: One of the best burgers around. Great burger and beer combo offer.

nrjCpx7CLRJbwBnxq0bCew.text: Constently good service, always have a great view of the game.

oy7jeKufcJxdMq48MdDqrw.text: Burger and a beer for 9.50 AND Pumpkin Porter on tap?! Yes, please, and thank you! Done and done! Amazing place

t0mBFtzcM2qsY7m4Bo1diw.text: The food is good, the service is friendly, and the tap beer selection is decent. It's a good place to hang out and watch a game. What more could you want?

MZgkZYxC856KlgetGPpYfQ.text: We always have a good meal at Mac's. Last night we had a bit of a wait for dinner but this was an exception. Still the best weekend breakfast value in the East Valley for us. The music is a bit loud, which makes it hard to hear sometimes, but is IS a small bother. Keep up the good work....

a-7vH4jqUh24f4AUC8EYsg.text: Cooks are ultra slow. I could have went into the kitchen to expedite food prep. I have worked at major resorts and restaurants who seat 1,500 a night. The cooks had no clue what they were doing. The bartender was minor league.

d9sClDB86zwH6mkUmwElbw.text: This place has been here for years so I decided to finally check it out. The atmosphere had the neighborhood feel to it, the crowd was older so I could they're probably regulars.   I ordered a jalapeno burger medium well and my friend ordered the classic cheese burger well done, the waitress said it will take 20 minutes to cook which is a bit long but fine. After nearly 35 minutes of waiting our food came out, the burgers were huge but bland. Although the quality of meat was good I thought it lacked flavor! The spicy mayo and jalapenos didn't compliment the burger at all.   The fries were just fries nothing special. My friends burger was very medium and very pink, not well done at all. I am not sure why it took so long to get our food if the burgers didn't come out well done. I don't like giving local places so so reviews but I had to on this one.

1Ivyw-0fAql3MxEtUHsxHA.text: Had lunch here on Super Bowl Sunday. They were closing at 2:00pm for a staff party. That's a first class move. I've always liked Mac's and this shows why!

vzOOnIQkxGW-cNSMxMhK2w.text: "The Mac's Attack" I assure you this is not about Mc Donald's, But instead it is about Mac's Broiler and Tap in Tempe, Arizona I actually crave food from here! That all by itself says a lot! I am a "foodie" But I don't really crave any certain kind of food. That is until I tried the "burger and a beer lunch special at Mac's Broiler and Taproom. At home my wife resticts us to white meat...Turkey, Chicken, Albacore Tuna. One day a buddy and I tried out Mac's Broiler and Tap 6430 S. McClintock Dr. Tempe, AZ 85283 480-755-3050 Join their Fan page on Facebook It was a pleasant surprise! Both of us thought the burger was the best we have had, I hear the French dip is also very good! macsbroilerandtap.com I have been there three times in the last month and I am never disappointed, The burger is cooked to a "Perfect Medium-Rare" My favorite is the Jalpeno Buger, cajun fries and a pint of O'dells IPA. The Sunday Breakfasts are fantastic too! This place has ties that go back to The Firehouse Restaurant that served great steaks to patrons of Tempe from their location on Apache Blvd. for many years. If you live in the area stop by and give it a try. If you visit Phoenix, make this a must do! I wish I lived closer to Mac's!!!

UvH4dtuLBNef-t7ugK3zUQ.text: Really enjoyed this cozy hidden spot in the heart of south Tempe. The atmosphere and service were relaxed and the food was appetizing and delicious. I tried the restaurant's take on Baked Ziti and quite enjoyed it. Recommended!

Pn4_csggXiJ1eAMCm59Z_A.text: First time here, couldn't decide so I got the ultimate grilled cheese and the hubby got the California grilled chicken sandwich, both were ah-mazing!! can't wait to come back!

JHS_QlgTGVYIMehDxDLlvw.text: We usually head there a couple of times a month on Sundays. Alas - today was probably the last time. Food is fine when you get it - today (and  once last month) waited over 45 minutes for food. this would have been somewhat tolerable if other guests who arrived after us (3 sets of couples) also waited for their food. We were told back up in kitchen....how is it that these other couples got their orders before ours?

PEhuI-8AUlTpRqxS50puXw.text: Macs is my go-to for comfort food. I absolutely love this place. The selection isn't huge, but they always have what I'm craving.   I was just here with my inlaws and some of their friends from PA. Apparently, we've convinced them this is one of THE places to go for food when in the valley. And I couldn't agree more. I absolutely love their fish sandwich. It's one of the few that is grilled and not fried.   Their French Fries are the perfectly addicting kind of shoe strings and their rotating selection of craft beers keeps it interesting. Their mixed drinks are a bit of a crap shoot- not a fan of their "macarita".   Plus, as a local establishment, they keep things local. For example, this week is AZ beer week and when we ordered the Huss beer (another one of our local favs), the Huss beer rep came over to thank us personally for ordering their beer, gave us some free Huss swag and talked to us a bit about beer and running (a personal hobby that she overheard while I was eating dinner).   Macs is the kind of place that makes you feel like a local and that you belong there. It's my "cheers". Don't worry, I won't start singing...but I'm tempted.

8bhMogTJ_a8iWV-i3UZOfQ.text: Having a belated St Patrick's Day and birthday dinner with my sweetheart. Trying a Shepard's pie and my wife is going with the petite filet. We absolutely love this place and are always more than satisfied!

vnGbnT4X6fkOuTnqYkORYw.text: Decided to take a couple of my clients out to lunch today to a restaurant that I had been to before.  As in my prior visits, the wait staff was very attentive to our needs, check back multiple times to see how we were doing and in our drinks needed refillings.  For Lunch I ordered the California Chicken Sandwich on 9 grain bread  and Steak Fries.  The sandwich was very tasty with just the right amount of seasoning and mayo, so that it was not soggy and messy.  The others in the party ordered the French Dip with French Fries, and the Fish Sandwich with French Fries.   Both liked their sandwiches and on the way back to the office asked for the address several times, so they could return.  My only issue on this visit was that the steak fries were not as hot and crispy has I have had in the past, otherwise it would have been a five.

bVAhvFD3-3KpveR3o9JUXw.text: Love the concept of Mac's a friendly local neighborhood small business eatery/bar. Breakfast too.  Looks like they've been trying to change things for the better and staff service seems to be improving. Great place for regulars to hang out but was totally turned off by the owner drinking pints at with the bar patrons while we ate breakfast...made it not so family friendly and took off the professional edge and a few stars. Can't see how the improvements will last when drinking in the AM without regard to the impression this leaves customers is a priority to the owner.  Time to think about the underlying issue here. Too bad as the potential was there.

hFzbSpM4ze0SC46F_TBlng.text: I thought.... Ok... I'll give Mac's one more try. We walked in with our kids (6 people total). We waited and no one came to seat us. The bartender looked at us a few times and did nothing. Congratulations for loosing our business. So sad.

qzxxCbF7a3F5grBH3Ql3nQ.text: Very friendly and laid back atmosphere. Food was delish and drinks went down easy. They were tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Broiler & Tap - Tempe, AZ, United States. Great food, the sage chicken was excellent!

t_zFgGcegoigOKdbuj962g.text: Stopped here unexpectedly last night (Friday) and was seated at a four-top even though it was pretty busy indoors.  I don't recall the name of my server, but he was oh so very patient w/ me as he tried to answer my food allergy concerns with everything from beer to specialties and the fish and chips (turns out his ex-girlfriend had food allergies, too).   I asked him for a beer recommendation since I've only started to appreciate beers; I've always liked fruity cocktails and sweet wines.  I've NEVER liked the taste of beers, although I did enjoy the sips of San Miguel light beer mixed with Sprite or Seven-Up that relatives would let slip for us kiddies to try.  However, with micro-breweries and seasonal brews a-plenty, I find that beer-tasting (and seeing which ones match well with food) can be as much fun as wine-tasting.  (Sounds like I've done a lot of beer-tasting, huh?  I can count the times I had a couple sips of beers on one hand!)  But I digress...  My server suggested a Blue Moon, which I almost didn't get to try since it looked like I was allergic to every dish I selected (he'd go to the back to double-check).  I think he could see I was about to bolt, bec. he suddenly appeared with a cold glass of Blue Moon, w/c came w/ an orange slice.  Since I didn't want to leave with an open bar ticket unpaid, I decided to throw caution to the wind and ordered the Fish and chips platter, even though the kitchen couldn't confirm that the batter was *-free.  Am I glad I did!  The platter took about 20 minutes to arrive, but when it did I was happily munching away on crispy, fresh-tasting beer-battered haddock, w/c I sprinkled with fresh lemon juice and occasionally dipped in tartar sauce.  Yessir, I was really living on the edge now!  *-allergy be damned!  I even sampled the itsy-bitsy side of coleslaw, w/c I'm pretty sure had * in the dressing.  Oh, and the beer tasted fine.  So much so, I almost bought a six-pack from Sunflower a couple of days later.  I'll be back to try other specialties and their burgers, of which Mac's is famous for.

HBV18LJEToeEEqxBH4EJ8w.text: This is next door to where I work sometimes. I have been here about 25 times as of this post, and it is a wonderful, quaint lunch spot with an excellent club sandwich!  They have great daily specials, and burger/brew deals.  Overall a good value for some good grub.

TTpizHK9dMckonkKizzEhQ.text: Love Macs! Great little Cheers type place. Friendly staff and locals, no douch bags. Good food decent selection of brews. Good down to earth atmosphere

6vM3wHmQAn54puwsMWUo-A.text: I have been three times and have determined that the burgers are some the best in the East Valley.  Lately, the Cuban sandwich have been my go-to.  If you wait til after 5pm to eat on weekends, expect to wait.  There are no shortage of eateries in the east valley, if people are waiting for the great food and excellent service, you know it will be good.  Very casual atmosphere......if you are looking for fine dining, go somewhere else.....if you are looking for great food and service....wait in line....you won't regret it.

VUbawA2QWl-ZI4nf9nFkOQ.text: Great place to stop into on a Saturday afternoon and miss the crowd. We forgot how delicious the burgers are here. The husband ordered the burger with grilled jalapenos, pepper jack cheese and ancho mayo. Loved it! A half pound patty cooked just right. He dove into the beer battered onion rings and knocked those out too. I got the patty melt, which was right on point and traditional.   Aimee was our server and catered to our needs very well. Refilled our drinks without letting them go bone dry. Super nice girl.

xXGX0pnRXsUsQvDlk7mMzQ.text: I was there for breakfast and football this morning.11am that's morning on Sunday,anyway I've been here before and he food was good,but...today it was just completely crappy.the service was piss poor,the coffee was good but the waitress was worthless I had to flag down two other ones to get refills.my wife got the corned beef hash which was good on a prior visit but today it was cremated before they put it on the plate,not bad if you like hash ashes. I had the chicken fried saw dust disk which was listed as chicken fried steak...the sun has more moisture than this thing!! The gravies only flavor was salt. When I told the disappearing waitress about the food she couldn't have cared less!! They sucked today and it's enough that I won't go back anytime soon, with so many options in Tempe they are now at the bottom if not off the list as they should be with you.....Happy Yelping

V3uuJpZFhssRY1Ra0GF8jw.text: I decided to take two of my girls out to see what we could discover today. We ended up at the bookstore next to this restaurant. As soon as we got to the bookstore my 8 year old decided she was hungry. The cafe in the bookstore was super busy so we walked next door to Macs and are so glad we did. Immediately we were seated and waited on by Michelle who had the best upbeat personality we have encountered in a really long time. She told us all of the specials and helped us pick our meals. My 16 year old and I both had the ultimate grilled cheese which was absolutely to die for. My 8 year old had the orange stung chicken. Everything was delicious. The album covers were interesting to look at. We had a very wonderful girls' day out thanks to Michelle and Mac's. We will definitely be going back soon. They had a sirloin sandwich on the menu I am dieing to try.

eoEFm4KlLcq4vtriG_PI6Q.text: After waiting over 35 minutes at another restaurant despite having a reservation we left and decided to check out Mac's.  We've eaten here several times in the past and have never been disappointed.  We were surprised but thankful that there wasn't a huge crowd. We walked in and got seated immediately, apparently we had just missed the rush.  Kory was an amazing waiter!  He was super personable and made our experience enjoyable. All of us enjoyed our meals.  Hubby had a peppercorn burger that was on the special menu. I had the petite filet that was cooked EXACTLY how I wanted it and daughter had her standby ultimate grilled cheese.  We left full and happy and will once again return and recommend to others.

p_5JdJpCwxYJaVUoKb09iQ.text: Food took an hour and everything tasted so generic (even the cocktails). Would call this more of a Dive Bar that serves food than a "Broiler and Tap". There are plenty of fresher and updated bar options in Phoenix for the same price.

puNQoW-UAhm8j_qv4EuOJQ.text: This is close to home and was here once before so decided to try it again.  This time was not so great.  The food was super salty, the onion soup had so much salt it was almost inedible.  The fish sandwich was not good, fishy taste and loaded with so much sauce had to scrape most of it off.  Most likely wont go back.

PM1TVdNYkJTdqOEReMeCpg.text: We had a gift card so decided to stop for dinner. The food was average. We got The Beast burger. It wasn't bad but a little on the dull side...could have used more seasoning. We were disappointed with only receiving a few fries on a menu item labeled The Beast.  Service was good and the staff was very pleasant.

coVzsiEbrwIAjrUw9M6OpQ.text: My husband and I just finished having lunch here. When we walked in it was just opening and so we expect it to be a little bit slow to start and that's fine. The bartender was sitting at the bar on her computer and when we said hello she said hello and that was it. She came over and got our beer order and the beer was poured well. I noticed that they had a prime rib sandwich and onion rings on their specials menu and decided that's what I wanted. I have severe dairy allergies (not lactose intolerance) and when the bartender did not come back for more than 5 minutes I asked the gentleman server if anything in that order contains dairy product. He politely told me he would have to go into the kitchen and ask. He returned moments later telling me that there is no dairy in anything mentioned in that dish. I specifically asked if he double-checked the onion rings and he said he did. This made me very happy. I proceeded to order the special and upon arrival immediately noticed that the order was incorrect. Instead of onion rings I got French fries. I politely pointed out that it was incorrect and the bartender, whom never gave us her name, took it right back to the kitchen and brought me out the sandwich by itself on a plate. I thought this was normal and thought the sandwich looked good. But when I touched it, I noticed that not only did it feel different but it smells different as well and knew that it was basted in butter product. I pointed this out to the bartender and she went and asked the cooks and immediately came back out and told me that she was sorry and took my sandwich from me. I then sat there for 10 minutes while my husband enjoyed his sandwich while it was hot. When it came back out I double-checked with her and asked her if she would please check the bread package for allergy information containing dairy. She said then the bread was made daily and she was unsure about that kind of information and wouldn't even know how to figure that out. I trusted the waiter when he said it earlier,  but now I'm worried, so I took off the bun. Now, no longer enjoying lunch, I looked up the information on the black and tan onion rings and found out they also have dairy in them. As I sit here having to cancel my plans for the rest of  the day bevause I trusted my server and bartender, I am appalled at the way this business has handled itself. When someone comes into a restaurant and points out very specifically that they have a severe food allergy it should be taken seriously. I cannot believe that they dismissed the concern I had about my own health. The fact that in today's day a restaurant is still not taking allergies seriously is dangerous. I would never recommend this place to anybody and in fact had numerous conversations while picking up my kid from school today about staying away from this restaurant.

HTx29__NbQNDwODZ3yO0hQ.text: Always friendly service. Good selection of beers. Prime rib Sunday special looks very tempting.

MbwBZS5uYyzj57rd9pF1IQ.text: Decent is a good word to describe this place. Decent food, decent service, decent atmosphere...   Food was different but not necessarily good different. Simple things like Mac and Cheese they didn't get quit right. A for effort but C for results.

XABBKdQqnpEy6sW-hzt3fw.text: Friday night last minute and hungry and tried 2 other places and wait was 30+ mins~ Snap fingers.. Oh yea, Mac's! Its just around the corner from us! I hadnt been there since the kids  ordered from the kiddie menu.  Seated within 5 mins. The place was busy and  we ran into a few neighborhood folks. Mac's is a family/ kid friendly place with a down homey atmosphere. I liked the 70s and 80s rock band photos on the  walls. I ordered the  baby back ribs one-half rack simmered in a tropical boil. finished on the char broiler and brushed with mac's BBQ sauce. served with coleslaw and baked potato. I opted for Veggies instead of Potato. Veggies done  perfect , i like to see the color still on my vege. My ribs were divine!  Moist meaty and fall off the bone and lean.(nothing worse than biting into a mouthful of fat and trying gracefully to spit it out)  Macs Ribs  are by far better than a few rib places I have been to. And the value absolutely reasonable. Actually how do they stay in business with such reasonable prices?  My daughter got the grilled mahi mahi char-grilled until just done and topped with cashew ginger butter. served with rice pilaf and sauteed house veggies~ She loved it.   I had to try it  and was blown away! The fish tasted fresh fresh fresh and ginger butter made my mouth water for more more more! I have to say the  rice pilaf tasted familiarly  like Uncle Bens, at any rate I  am not  much of a rice eater in the first place. I had a great glass of Red wine, cant remember if it was Cab or Shiraz which is my go to Red of choice.  its literally 5 mins from our home and We cant wait to return!

uJ805_UP4keQtflEvJ1iAg.text: Service can be a little spotty at a table but the food is really delish, bar service w/food has always been very attentive,one of my favorite places to pop in from time to time. Food is very tasty.

QcARfZdJsQSSd__fKxbfGQ.text: Reasonably priced breakfast with large portions.  We had the huevos rancheros ($6.50) which was very flavorful and filling, and the pancake breakfast ($6.50).  The pancake breakfast comes with your choice of pecan or banana inside the pancake batter.  I chose pecan, and there were lots of toasted pecans in the pancakes providing a nutty crunch.  It was served with 2 eggs and breakfast meat.  I chose the ham, and it came out in a thick, large, grilled slice, a very good value for your meal.  The eggs were cooked perfectly, and the pancakes themselves were fairly large, and came in a stack of 2.  The coffee was nothing special ($1.50), but it did get refilled often by our attentive server.  All in all, a pleasant brunch for a Sunday late afternoon.

JgT4Id-NkYxB-n218JLKcQ.text: Yup, won't be back. After waiting 15 minutes to take our order, then 30 minutes for our food after that, the food was average. Then we waited another 15 minutes to get our check.  Had high hopes for the place.

5NUaAmhB5n6xdDUjwCm59Q.text: We noticed the name of the establishment several months ago, and since the name of the place was the same as my Dad's moniker we thought it sounded cool. So on Fathers Day 2013 we decided to try this for a fathers day meal.   And we were very pleased.   And being a chef for over 40 years I can be hard to please when it comes to food.   Even though the place was busy the wait staff was very courteous and prompt.  And the burgers were the best we ever had.   And I just love a good beer with my meal, and they more than met my expectations with their choice of beers on tap.   We will definitely return and have another very enjoyable meal.

8zNxZTIQxc2RiacU6YaShw.text: We had a happy hour planned at Flanny's but when we remembered it was tap takeover night, which is always such a zoo, we decided to head up to Mac's. Our server was very nice to us even though we were just having drinks and not food. I have eaten here many times before and the food is respectable. It's not going to thrill anyone but it's good at typical American bar food. I like that they always have an IPA on draft.

y_Bno65Hq8L29_oYFeSyjw.text: Mac's is locally owned and is an awesome neighborhood spot. The food is good, the service is excellent and there are plenty of TV's around the restaurant - usually showing sports. There's always some sort of special on the menu. Hard to nail down a certain type of faire; burgers, hot/cold sandwiches, salads, seafood, pasta, steaks, chicken. You won't rave about the food necessarily, but you'll leave full, happy and dinner won't break the bank.

KYSdNQIE_zu3pZU5T1SeOg.text: What a nice surprise!  We dropped in for lunch.  A lot of variety on the menu. We both ordered the Southwestern Shrimp. It was delicious!  Larger grilled shrimp on a skewer, rice pilaf, served with a medley of vegetables. It was all cooked to perfection. Price was very reasonable too!  They have my favorite fresh brewed ice tea too. (Passion Fruit)   We will definitely be back. Nice waitress...

L8Zj5zi4eOIhQLkWjBXeCg.text: Service was pretty was quick and friendly, granted it wasn't very busy when we went in. The chipotle chicken sandwich was soggy, so I just pulled off the bread and lettuce and ate the chicken.  It tasted like dry and previously frozen, but it wasn't terrible. The coleslaw tasted like it had been sitting in a bucket for days. We pulled pieces of paper, which looked like they had come from a straw, from out of our little bowl, which I'll tell you, is pretty unappetizing. I won't be back.

mmit77YjBsXKkHSKyf62rQ.text: Went there for lunch and the place was kind of busy. The service was not bad but the food was TERRIBLE. I ordered the steak sub (I forget now what they called it exactly). First of all, food came out luke warm and my daughter's mac n cheese was good ol' Kraft :)...my bread was soggy on the bottom from the sandwich that sat around too long with the overly cooked onions slopped onto it. The steak medallions were weird: flavorless and slightly chewy and with the texture of boiled meat. Won't be going back.

DKbICpNGrMnyZ4EwiEBbYQ.text: Great food and beer. Loved the service and my kids enjoyed it too. Locally owned a bonus!

AV3KH4HwFDbgFRdVsSygMQ.text: Ordered the Siete Mares and it is out of sight!  If I were ordering this anywhere in Scottsdale it would have cost triple what they charge.  5 blue mussels, 5 clams, several large shrimp.  Spicy, served on a bed of angel hair pasta with Texas toast to die for.  Oh, and did I mention their  beer menu is awesome...

ncvG8FQX13EhgKrnoJF-Zw.text: Mac Attack By The Rue  It's 11:30 and I say damn I'm hungry, Getting the shakes like a methadone junkie, I think, do I want this or do I want that?  Are kidding me? I'm going to Mac's.   Ohhhhhhhhhhhhh, I've eaten here before, I get the spicey roast beef, Even if it's dropped on the floor.  My order is in with a side of fries,  Cajun style is no surprise, Love that pickle spear it comes with, I'm telling you all, this is THE dish.   Ohhhhhhhhhhhhh, I eat here all the time, They never screw uppppp, It's a favorite of mine.  The tea is always topped off, When in Germany I listen to the Hoff, Sit on the patio and go ahead and stare, Hotties all around who just don't care.   Ohhhhhhhhhh I love my Mac's, Awesome local broiler, And great beer on tap!  That's All
